Direction for the ≈øame: let them all face to the Reer, and the middle-divi≈øion of Muskettiers move forwards, and flank the Reer-divi≈øion of Pikes; after let all the Muskettiers advance forwards three foot cleer of their own divi≈øions of Pikes, and give Fire, falling in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after facing about, move into their places again.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them Fire as they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and the Pikes in the Reer may charge on, and after facing to their Leader.

Command. The outmo≈øt divi≈øions face inward, march three paces; and the next two divi≈øions face outward, and move two paces; to your Leader: Reer-divi≈øion, move outward until you ≈øtand ≈øtreight with the Front-divi≈øions.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-Divi≈øion of Muskettiers give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after moving down in the room of them in the Reer: they at the ≈øame time moving up into the Front firing, in like manner moving down, and exchanging places with them in the Reer.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers upon the Flanks move forward even with the Front, give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after move down into their places again, and face to their Leader.
The third firing. Let them face to the Front, reer, and both Flanks, and let the Pikes port, and the Muskettiers give fire.
The fourth firing. Let them give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of the Pikes; the Pikes charging while≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again.
The fifth firing. Let the Pikes charge at foot, and the Muskettiers give fire over their heads; then recovering their Arms, face to their Leader.

Reducement. Front-Divi≈øions face about; Front and Reer-Divi≈øions march, and interchange ground, to your Leader; The out-mo≈øt Divi≈øions face inward, and clo≈øe your Divi≈øions, to your Leader: even your Ranks, and ≈øtreighten your Files, and clo≈øe to Order, they are reduced.
The Captain may now command the Muskettiers to poy≈øe their Arms, and file away to the right and left, making as it were a Street or Gallery for him to troop away the Pikes, and lodge his Colours.

div.head: CHAP. VII. The ≈øecond Exerci≈øe, with four Files ≈øix deep.
div.p: THe Souldiers being the ≈øecond time ≈øummoned to appear at their place of Rendezvous, the Sergeants having drawn forth the Files, may give liberty to the Leaders thereof to exerci≈øe them in their ≈øeveral Po≈øtures; which being ended, their Captain or other Officers may command them to lead up their Files, and to joyn them into a Body; after which he may ≈øhew unto them their Di≈øtances, and Facings, with their ≈øeveral kinds, following the former rule, and after proceed to the≈øe or the like Doublings following.

div.head: CHAP. VIII. Eighteen ≈øeveral Doublings with their reducements.
div.p: Command. HAlf-files, double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your files to the right intire, advancing.
Command. Front half-files, double your Reer to the right intire.
Command. Left half-ranks, double your right Flank to the left.
Direction. Face all to the right, and left-half-ranks move forward; and double your right Flank to the left, to your Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks to the left intire.
Command. Right half-ranks, double your left Flank intire, advancing.
Command. Left half-ranks, double your right Flank inward intire.

Direction. Half-files of the right half-ranks, face about; right half-ranks, move cleer of the ≈øtanding part; face all to the right: left half-ranks, move forwards into the right Flank, to your Leader.
Command. The three fir≈øt, and the three la≈øt Ranks, double the ≈øix middle-mo≈øt intire to the left Flank.
Direction. The three fir≈øt, and the three la≈øt, face to the left, march cleer of the ≈øtanding part, face inward, move, and clo≈øe your Divi≈øions, to your Leader.
Command. Right half-ranks, double your left Flank to the right.
Direction. Face all to the left, and right half-ranks move forwards, and double your left Flank to the right, to your Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks to the right intire.
Command. Right half-ranks double your left Flank inward intire.
Command. The three fir≈øt, and the three la≈øt Ranks, double the ≈øix middle-mo≈øt Ranks intire to the right Flank.
Command. Left half-ranks, double your right Flank intire, advancing.
Command. Front half-files, double your Reer to the left intire.
Command. Half-files, double your Front to the right.
Command. Double your Files to the left intire advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Front half-files, double your Reer to the right, following your Leaders.
Direction. Half-files, face about; File-leaders, turn off to the left, and move down upon the right of the Reer, the re≈øt following ≈øucce≈ø≈øively; to your Leader.
Command. Files double your Depth to the left intire; they are reduced being faced to their Leader.

div.head: CHAP. IX. Twelve ≈øeveral Counter-marches, with their reducements.
div.p: Command. FIles to the right hand countermarch, lo≈øing ground.
Command. Ranks to the right hand counter-march, lo≈øing ground.
Direction. Face all to the right.
Command. Front and Reer half-files, inter-change ground.
Direction. Front half-files, face about to the left.
Command. Right and left half-ranks, inter-change ground.
Direction. Face inward.
Command. File-leaders, face about; the re≈øt pa≈øs through to the right, a place your ≈øelves behinde your Leaders; face to the Front.
Command. Counter-march your Front and Reer into the mid≈øt.
Command. Counter-march your Flanks into the mid≈øt. Face out-ward.
Command. File-leaders, and Half-file-leaders, ≈øtand; the re≈øt pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves before your Leaders, and Half-file-leaders.
Direction. The ≈øecond Rank from the Front, and from the Half-file-leaders, are to begin the Motion, placing them≈øelves, as before commanded.
Command. The out-mo≈øt File upon the right, and the ≈øecond File from the ≈øtand; the re≈øt pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves on the out-≈øide of your right-hand men.
Command. Files to the left-hand counter-march, lo≈øing ground.
Command. Front and Reer half-files, counter-march to the right.
Direction. Front and Reer half-files, turn off di≈øtinctly by your ≈øelves, on the ground you ≈øtand; face to your Leader.
Command. Right and left Half-ranks, counter-march to the right.
Direction. Face to the right; and right and left Half-ranks, turn off di≈øtinctly to the right; face to your Leader, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. X. Twelve ≈øeveral Wheelings, with their Reducements.
div.p: Command. WHeel your Reer Half-files inward into the mid≈øt, and double the Front inward intire.

Direction. Right and left Half-ranks, open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance; Reer half-files face about, and wheel your Reer inward into the mid≈øt, moving forward, doubling the Front inward intire.
Command. Wheel off your Right half-ranks, and double your left Flank to the left intire.
Direction. Face outward right Half-ranks, wheel about to the right, and double your left Flank to the left; to your Leader.
Command. Right and left Half-ranks, double the Length of your Battail by wheeling outward to the Front.
Direction. Face outward, and right Half-ranks, wheel to the left, and left Half-ranks, wheel to the right, and after clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to order.
Command. Wheel off your right Half-ranks, and double your left Flank by Divi≈øion.
Direction. Face outward: right Half-ranks, wheel about to the right and left outward, moving forward, & doubling the left Flank to the right & left outward.
Command. Wheel your left Half-ranks inward into the right Flank.
Direction. Face outward, and open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance; the Front and Reer half-files, and after the left Half-Ranks may wheel inward, and double the right Flank inward intire.
Command. Wheele off your Reer Half-files, and double your Front to the left entire; Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel your right Half-ranks inward into the mid≈øt, and double the left Flank inward entire.
Direction. Face outward; and Front and Reer Half-files that were, are to open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance, and right Half-ranks wheel inward, and move forward into the left Flank.
Command. Wheel off your Reer Half-files, and double your Front to the right entire; Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel off your left Half-ranks, and double your right Flank by Divi≈øion.
Command. Wheel off your Front Half-files, and double your Reer to the right entire: Half-files face about.
Command. Double the Depth of the Battail by wheeling Front and Reer into the mid≈øt of each Divi≈øion.
Direction. Front Half-files move forward four paces, then the la≈øt Rank of each Divi≈øion face about, and wheel into the mid≈øt of Front and Reer of each Divi≈øion; face to your Leader.
Command. Wheel off your Front Half-files, and double your Reer to the left entire; Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel your Battail off by Divi≈øion from the Reer.

Direction. Face all about, and right Half-ranks wheel about to the right and left outward to the Front; and clo≈øing Files into the mid≈øt to Order, they will be reduced as at fir≈øt, and ≈øtand as underneath is ≈øet forth.

div.head: CHAP. XI. Several plain Firings upon this Exerci≈øe of 24 men, with Figures of Battail belonging to the ≈øame.
div.p: A Commander having thus pa≈ø≈øed over the Motions, may next prepare for Firings; and calling up his Serjeants, he may give them order how the Mu≈økettiers ≈øhall fire in Front and Reer: but before he begin his Firings, it will be expedient that he double his Front to the right and left inward by the Bringers-up, which being ended, he may proceed as followeth.
The fir≈øt Firing. Let them fire by Divi≈øions drawn forth ten paces before the Front of Pikes, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.
The ≈øecond Firing. Let them fire again, and fall off to the right and left, moving down before the Front of Pikes, and clo≈øing their Divi≈øions.

The third Firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank kneel down, the next ≈øtoop, and the la≈øt ≈øtand upright, and give fire altogether; the Pikes in the mean time are to advance their Arms, and open to the right and left, charge on to the Front, until they be clear of the Muskettiers, and then face inwards, and clo≈øe their Divi≈øions; then facing all about, they may give fire to the Reer marching.
The fourth Firing. Let the la≈øt Rank face about to the left, and give fire, and fall off to the right and left, placing them≈øelves before their Leaders of their own Divi≈øions of Muskettiers.

The fifth Firing. Let them face about to the left again, give fire; and fall off to
the right and left, and flank their Pikes, the Pikes at the ≈øame in≈øtant facing about, and charge on clear of the Muskettiers, the Muskettiers after facing inward, and clo≈øe their Divi≈øions: the Pikes may charge to the Hor≈øe, and the Muskettiers may give fire over their heads after this manner.

The ≈øixth Firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank ≈øtoop, and the other two ≈øtand upright, and give fire altogether; after recovering of their Arms, they may all face to the Front, commanding the Pikes to double the Front inward entire, and afterwards Files to double their Depth to the right and left outward, every man falling behind his Bringer-up, clo≈øing Files into the mid≈øt to Order, and wheeling about into the fir≈øt Front, he may proceed as followeth.
Command. Front Half-files advance forwards three paces; the middle Rank of each Divi≈øion face outward, and move clear of the ≈øtanding part; face to your Leader.

The fir≈øt Firing. Let the inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Front fire, and fall off in the Reer of them≈øelves; after facing about, move down, and interchange ground with them in the Reer; they at the ≈øame in≈øtant moving up, firing, and in like manner interchanging ground with them in the Reer; and at the ≈øame time the outmo≈øt men are to move up, and fire to the Front, and to fall off to the right and left, into the place of them in the Reer, they at the ≈øame time moving up, and firing in like manner: this firing may be continued twice over.

The ≈øecond Firing. Let them face to both the Flanks, and let the Divi≈øions of Pikes in the mid≈øt open outward until they be clear of the ≈øtanding part, then Porting; let the Muskettiers give fire on the ≈øame ground they ≈øtand, and the Pikes after may charge on until the Muskettiers make ready again, and then retreating into their places again, the Muskettiers may give fire, as before is mentioned, the Pikes in like manner charging on, then retreating to their places; face all to their Leader.

Command. Inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes move to the left one pace, and double to the right File-wi≈øe, and face to Front and Reer, and march three paces; middle File of Front and Reer-Divi≈øions open from the mid≈øt to double Di≈øtance; face to your Leader.
The fir≈øt firing. Face to Front and Reer, and then give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers move forwards, and the inmo≈øt Divi≈øion rank outward into Front and Reer, and then give Fire altogether, and file as they were; the Pikes may charge whil≈øt they make ready, and fall into their places again, they may continue upon this Firing a ≈øecond time.

The third firing. Let the Muskettiers, and the two outmo≈øt men of the Pikes, face to both Flanks; and likewi≈øe the Middle-divi≈øions of Pikes are to face to both Flanks after this manner: the fir≈øt two of the Reer-divi≈øion are to face to the right, and the two la≈øt men of the Front-divi≈øion are to face to the left; then let the Muskettiers give fire to both Flanks; and the Pikes may after charge to the Front, Reer, and both Flanks until the Muskettiers make ready again; this Firing may be continued twice; to your Leader.

Command. The outmo≈øt ≈øingle men of Muskettiers in the Front-divion, face about; the two outmo≈øt men of Muskettiers, both of Front and Reer-divi≈øions move forward and clo≈øe to order; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe inward to open Order.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them give Fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, then face about and move down into the Reer; the re≈øt moving up ≈øucce≈ø≈øively, giving Fire and falling off in like manner; this may be continued twice over; then face them to the Reer, and let the Muskettiers rank to the right and left outward.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank of each Divi≈øion give Fire, and fall off to the right and left in manner and form of the former Firing, until they have Fired twice over; then to file as they were, and face to their Leader.

Command. Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes move to the right one pace; the ≈øecond Divi≈øion of Pikes move forward, and double the Front to the left; the ≈øecond Divi≈øion of Pikes from the Reer, face about; move down and double the
Pikes in the Reer to the left; to your Leader: Middle-divi≈øions of Muskettiers open outward to twice double di≈øtance; face all to the Center, and march two or three paces; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. The three la≈øt Divi≈øions, face to the Reer; the two outmo≈øt men both of Pikes and Muskettiers, face to the Flanks; then let them all give Fire, and fall in the Reer of the Pikes; the Pikes may charge while the Muskettiers make ready again.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers move forth and give Fire as at fir≈øt, and after fall in again.
The third firing. Let them give Fire by Extraduction, and fall again in the Reer of the Pikes.
The fourth firing. Let the Pikes charge the Hor≈øe, and the Muskettiers give Fire altogether over their heads; then move forth into their fir≈øt places, and face to their Leader.

Command. Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers open outward to double di≈øtance; the outmo≈øt men of Pikes clo≈øe inward to open order: the third Rank of Pikes from the Front, face about; the third Rank of Pikes from the Front, and the third Rank of Pikes from the Reer, move forwards to order; face to your Leader: Front and Reer-divi≈øions, ≈øtand; the re≈øt face outward, and move two paces, to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt Divi≈øions Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheeling off to the right and left into the place of tho≈øe Muskettiers in the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving forward into their places, and firing, falling off in like manner; the Muskettiers may give Fire on the ground they ≈øtand, falling in the Reer of them≈øelves: This firing being twice performed, we proceed to another.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers and tho≈øe upon the Flanks give Fire, and fall in the mid≈øt of Pikes; in the mean time the la≈øt Divi≈øion of Pikes may open outward until they be cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let
Pikes charge all whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again: This firing may be performed twice; after which, let them move forth into their places again; and face to Front and Reer, and give Fire, and fall off in the Reer of them≈øelves: the Pikes may charge, which being ended, face them to their Leader.

Command. The la≈øt Rank of Pikes of the Middle-divi≈øion, face about; middle-divi≈øion of Pikes move forward, until you range even abre≈øt with the mid≈øt of the Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes; to your Leader: the la≈øt man of the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about; outmo≈øt-men move forward three paces, and face to your Leader: Ranks of the Front and Reer-divi≈øions open from the mid≈øt to open order; Reer-divi≈øions move forward two paces.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them Fire to the Front, and fall in between the Pikes: this may be done twice; after which, face to the Front and Reer, and Fire there in the ≈øame manner: then let Pikes and Muskettiers intercharge ground, let them give Fire altogether unto Front and Reer; then facing about, interchange ground with the Pikes, who are to charge on whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready; then retreating, let them all face outwards, and they will ≈øtand in form like a Saw, after they have moved two paces.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers give Fire altogether to both Flanks, and the Pikes to charge on; after retreating, they may order their Arms, and face all to their Leader.

Reducement. The outmo≈øt Muskettiers upon the Flanks, move to right and left inward, placing them≈øelves in the mid≈øt of their own divi≈øions; the outmo≈øt men of Pikes to ≈øtand, the re≈øt to double Ranks to the left; and the fir≈øt Rank of Pikes to double to the right File-wi≈øe, and the ≈øecond Rank from the Reer to double to the left File-wi≈øe; after let the outmo≈øt men of Pikes double their inmo≈øt Files into the mid≈øt; then moving forward their divi≈øions, evening their Front, clo≈øing Files to the mid≈øt to order, they are reduced.
And now we will lodge our Colours, and repo≈øe our ≈øelves, until by the beat of the Drum we ≈øhall be ≈øummon'd to make our appearance.

div.head: CHAP. XII. The third Exerci≈øe, with four Files ≈øix deep.
div.p:
BEing the third time brought into the Field compleatly arm'd, where being drawn forth into Files, and by the Leaders thereof exerci≈øed, as before; they are commanded to lead up their Files; yet not pre≈øuming to place them≈øelves, but leaves that to the di≈øcretion of their Superiour Officers, who knows be≈øt the de≈øert of each particular man. But by the way, give me leave in this place to tell the Souldiers and Leaders of our private Meetings, that this decorum is not rightly ob≈øerved: the Souldier thinking him≈øelf wi≈øer then his Leader, pre≈øumes to chop and change by Counter-marching of his File, making ≈øome part of the Reer to be more honourable then the Front, which cannot be; for the younge≈øt Souldier
there is of more honor then the elde≈øt in the Reer, in regard it is the more honorable part of the Battalia, therefore it is plain, that they take more upon them then becomes them; for no File-leader ought to meddle with his File in matter of motions, without con≈øent of the ≈øuperior Officers; neither ought the Leader either through favour, or out of malice, when all the Files are joyned into one compleat Body, to Countermarch the Files, (and after proceeding to other Motions) depriving thereby the Leaders thereof of their due honour; for el≈øe, why (ju≈øt in the time of Exerci≈øe or Marching) ≈øhould one ≈øingle File, as the right or left, be Countermarched, if he bore not malice to ≈øome, thru≈øting them by this un≈øouldier-like way out of their places, and through favour or affection often times putting men of little de≈øert into their places? To leave this di≈øcour≈øe, not plea≈øing to ≈øome, let the Commander draw forth one File of Pikes, and double it by the Half-file, and ≈øend a Serjeant to fetch the Colours; and after clo≈øing his Ranks and Files to Order, he may begin to make ≈øome alteration in the exerci≈øing of them in their Motions, ≈øpending his time altogether upon Inver≈øion and Conver≈øion.

div.head: CHAP. XIII. Thirty ≈øeveral Words of Command of Inver≈øion and Conver≈øion.
div.p: Command. RAnks, rank entire to the left into the Front.
Direction. The fir≈øt Rank ≈øtand, the re≈øt face to the left, and ≈øucce≈øsively move into the Front.
Command. Ranks, rank four to the left.
Direction. The fir≈øt four upon the left ≈øtand, the re≈øt face to the left, and by fours fall ≈øucce≈øsively behind the fir≈øt four upon the left.
Command. Files, rank outward into the Front.
Direction. The inmo≈øt Files ≈øtand, the re≈øt open outward to double di≈øtance, and after rank outward into the Front.
Command. Ranks, file three to the right and left outward by wheeling.
Direction. The three outmo≈øt men upon the right and left wheel to the right and left outward, the re≈øt doing the like by threes; after clo≈øe into the mid≈øt to Order, and face to their Leader.
Command. Files, rank inward into the Reer.
Direction. Face to the Reer, and move to the right and left inward into the Reer; to your Leader.
Command. Ranks, file ≈øix to the right and left outward, advancing.

Direction. The outmo≈øt man upon the right and left ≈øtand, the re≈øt move outward until they be ≈øix in a File, and the next outmo≈øt men are to ≈øtand, the other doing the like, and after clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Files, rank inward into the mid≈øt of Ranks.

Direction. Front Half-files face about, and right and left Half-ranks open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance, the re≈øt open outward to Order, and move to the right and feft inward to the mid≈øt of Ranks; to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files inward to Order.
Command. Ranks, file 12 to the right and left inward, every man placing him≈øelf before the Leaders and Bringers up of the middle Files.

Direction. Ranks, open backward to double di≈øtance, the middle File ≈øtand, the re≈øt advance forwards, and file twelve to the right and left inward, placing them≈øelves before the Leaders, and Bringers-up of the middle Files.
Command. Files, rank ≈øix to the right and left inward.

Direction. Files, open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance, and move three to the right, and three to the left inward, until you have made four Ranks ≈øix abre≈øt; after clo≈øe Ranks forward to Order.
Command. Ranks, rank outward into Front and Reer, every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øide of his right and left-hand-man.
Direction. Half-Files face about, and rank to the right and left outward into Front and Reer as is commanded; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks forward to Order.
Command. Ranks, file 12 to the right and left inward, every man placing him≈øelf behind the Leaders and Bringers-up of the middle Files.

Direction. Ranks, open backward to double di≈øtance, the middle Files ≈øtand, the re≈øt move ≈øide-ways to the right and left, and place your ≈øelves behind the Leaders and Bringers up of the middle Files.
Command. Files, rank ≈øix to the right and left inward into Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt.

Direction. The three la≈øt Ranks of the Front and Reer Half-files face about, and Files open outward to double di≈øtance, and move to the right and left inward into Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt, making four Ranks ≈øix abre≈øt; after face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks forward to Order.
Command. Ranks, rank outward into the Mid≈øt.
Direction. Front Half-files face about, and move outward, and rank to the Mid≈øt, and face to your Leader.
Command. Ranks, wheel to the right and left outward.
Direction. Half-files face about, and wheel to the right and left outward into both the Flanks; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Files, rank ≈øix to the right and left outward into Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt.

Direction. The three la≈øt Ranks of the Front and Reer Half-files face about, and rank outward, three to the right, and three to the left into Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks and Files to their di≈øtance of Order.
Command. Ranks, file to the right entire, advancing.
Direction. The outmo≈øt File ≈øtand, the re≈øt move forward, and file to the right entire, advancing.
Command. Files, rank three to the right.
Direction. The fir≈øt three men from the Front rank three to the right, the re≈øt ≈øucce≈ø≈øively doing the ≈øame, clo≈øing Ranks forward to Order.
Command. Ranks, wheel to the left.
Direction. Ranks, open backward to open Order, and wheel to the left.
Command. Files, rank ≈øix to the left.
Direction. The fir≈øt ≈øix men rank ≈øix to the left, the re≈øt ≈øucce≈ø≈øively doing the ≈øame, until they have made four Ranks ≈øix abre≈øt, then clo≈øe Ranks forwards to Order.
Command. Ranks, rank outward into the mid≈øt, every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øid≈øt of his right and left-hand-man.
Direction. Front Half-files face about, and Front and Reer Half-files rank outward into the mid≈øt, placing your ≈øelves on the out≈øide of your right and left-hand-men; face to your Leader.
Command. Ranks, wheel three to the right and left outward.

Direction. The la≈øt Rank face about, and wheel by threes to the right and left outward towards both Flanks; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files to the right to Order, they will ≈øtand four abre≈øt, and ≈øix deep.
Command. Files, file outward entire, advancing.
Direction. The outmo≈øt File ≈øtand, the re≈øt advance forward, and place your ≈øelves before the outmo≈øt Files; after clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Files, file to the right.
Direction. The right-hand-File ≈øtand, the re≈øt face about, and fall in the Reer of your right-hand-File; to your Leader.
Command. Files, file twelve to the right.
Direction. The fir≈øt twelve ≈øtand, the other move forward, filing twelve to the right.
Command. Files, wheel inward into Front and Reer.

Direction. Files open from the mid≈øt to twice double di≈øtance, after face inward, and wheele ≈øix to the right, and ≈øix to the left, until you have made two Ranks twelve abre≈øt; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks forwards to Order.
Command. Ranks wheele inward to both the Flanks.

Direction. Ranks, open from the mid≈øt to twice double di≈øtance; the fir≈øt Rank, face about; the fir≈øt and the la≈øt Rank, wheel ≈øix to the right, and ≈øix to the left inward to both the Flanks; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files to the mid≈øt to order.
Command. Files, file three to the right and left outward into Front and Reer.

Direction. Half-files, face about; the three fir≈øt and the three la≈øt Ranks are to ≈øtand; the re≈øt are to move by threes, filing to Front and Reer to the right and left outward; and after face to the Front, and clo≈øe their Ranks forwards to order.
Command. Files, file to the mid≈øt by Divi≈øion.
Direction. Half-files of the outmo≈øt Files, face about; and the outmo≈øt Files move forwards, and file by Divi≈øion unto the mid≈øt of Files; face to your Leader.
Command. Files, rank inward into the Front.
Direction. Files, open from the mid≈øt to twice double di≈øtance, and move forward to the right and left inward into the Front.
Command. Ranks, file ≈øix to the right and left outward.

Direction. The outmo≈øt men are to ≈øtand; the re≈øt are to move ≈øide-ways to the right and left, making ≈øix in a File; and then the next out≈øide men in like manner are to ≈øtand, the re≈øt ≈øucce≈ø≈øively are to file as before.

div.head: CHAP. XIV. Next followeth ≈øeveral Figures of Battail, with Firings upon the ≈øame, for the performance whereof,
div.p: Command. BRingers-up to double their Front to the right and left inward, and Ranks and Files to open to open order, and Muskettiers to clo≈øe outward to clo≈øe order; the inmo≈øt Files of Pikes clo≈øe outward to the ≈øame di≈øtance, and they will ≈øtand in four Divi≈øions; after let the Middle-rank in each Divi≈øion open outward to open order, they will produce the fir≈øt Figure.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank give Fire, and wheel off to the right and left, and place them≈øelves in the room of them in the Reer; and they at the ≈øame time moving forwards in their places, and give Fire as the fir≈øt; after wheel off into their places again.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Middle-ranks advance three foot before the Front, and give Fire; face about, and move down into their places again.

Command. The la≈øt Rank in each Divi≈øion move to the left one pace, and double to the right File-wi≈øe; and then advance forward, until their fir≈øt men exceed two foot the Front of each Divi≈øion; then let the fir≈øt Rank open outward to open order, and the la≈øt Rank clo≈øe inward to the ≈øame di≈øtance.
The fir≈øt firing. Let the middle File give Fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and after fall off to the right and left into the room of them in the Reer, they at the ≈øame time moving forward into their ground, and give fire in like manner, and fall off into their places again, and then the Pikes may charge on while≈øt the Mu≈økettiers make ready again.
Command. Face all about: middle File, move forward three foot clear of the Reer; the fir≈øt Rank clo≈øe inward to Order, the la≈øt Rank open outward ≈øomething more then to open Order.

Upon this Figure let the fir≈øt man in each divi≈øion kneel down, and then to give fire altogether over one anothers heads, the Pikes at the ≈øame time charging bre≈øt-high to the Hor≈øe; then face all to their fir≈øt Front.

Command. The la≈øt men in the Reer double to the left Rank-wi≈øe; Files, clo≈øe into the mid≈øt to Order; Muskettiers, double your Pikes inward entire advancing, and move forward three paces; Files, double your depth to the right and left outward of each Arms, every man falling behind his Bringer-up; Front Half-files, double your Reer entire into the mid≈øt; Files, double to the right and left outward; Files, file to the right entire advancing: which being done, wheel them to the right about into a Ring, in form as followeth.

Upon this Figure let the Pikes charge round, and the Muskettiers give fire all together; which being ended, let the Commander go to the place where the File-Leader ≈øtands, and wheel them off again to the left until he hath brought them into one ≈øtraight File, and then proceed.

Command. Half-files, double your Front to the right; Ranks, double to the right and left inward; Files, double outward entire, advancing; Half-files of each Arms, double your Ranks forwards to the left; Front Half-files, double the Reer to the left; Files, file to the left entire, advancing, and wheel about into a Ring; then face all to the Center, and clo≈øe Files of each Arms to the right and left inward to clo≈øe Order.
Command. Middle-men in each Divi≈øion move backward, and place your ≈øelves two foot behind your right and left-hand-men; face all about to the right, and clo≈øe Ranks inward to Order.

Upon this Figure let them Fire by circumduction after this manner; let the odd men of Pikes port; and then the odd Muskettier, where the fir≈øt Front was, is to give Fire, and to move away to the left; and the next odd man of Muskettiers upon the right, immediately comes ≈øtooping underneath the Pikes into the fir≈øt mans place, Firing in like manner, moving away into the next odd mans place of the Muskettiers upon the left; the re≈øt doing the ≈øame until the Muskettier come into his place again.
Command. Face all to the Center; odd men move forwards and place your ≈øelves two foot before the right and left-hand-men; after face all to the right about.

Upon this Figure you may Fire likewi≈øe by way of circumduction: the Pikes porting all round, and having performed one Firing in this manner; in the next place, let the odd Muskettiers and Pikes move forth again, and kneel down; the odd Pike-men charging at foot, the Muskettiers may give Fire altogether; then let them face to the Center, and let the odd men move forwards, and place them≈øelves between the right and left-hand-men; then moving and clo≈øing their ring, let them face all about to the right: Then let the Captain go where the Leader of the File ≈øtands, and wheel him about to the left; the re≈øt following until they be all brought again into one ≈øtreight File.

Command. Files, file three to the left into the Front; Files, double to the right intire advancing; Front-half-files, move forwards three paces; Files, double your depth to the right of each Divi≈øion; Half-files, double your Front intire into the mid≈øt. The two fir≈øt and the two la≈øt men of Pikes upon each Flank, face inward; the two Middle-ranks, face outward; the two la≈øt Ranks of Muskettiers, face about; march all three paces; to your Leader.
To pa≈øs by the Firings which may be performed upon this Figure, I ≈øhall proceed from hence to draw another.

Command. The outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers clo≈øe inward to order; Front and Reer Divi≈øions of Pikes, open outward to double di≈øtance; Pikes, double inward Rank-wi≈øe, and they will ≈øtand as followeth.

Upon this Figure Fire to the Front in their ≈øeveral Divi≈øions one after another, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right into the Reer, the re≈øt of the Divi≈øions moving forward in their room, doing the like until all have fired over twice.
Command. Muskettiers, double your Ranks outward in each Divi≈øion, and they will ≈øtand as underneath.

Upon this Figure, as in the former, they may Fire likewi≈øe to the Front, falling down into the Reer; and after every Rank ≈øucce≈ø≈øively moving up into the Front, may Fire and fall off in like manner: this Firing may be done twice to the Front; and being faced to the Reer, they may there give Fire after this manner, and after face to their fir≈øt Front.

Command. Muskettiers, double to the right and left inward File-wi≈øe; middlemo≈øt divi≈øion of Muskettiers, face outward, and march until you have placed your ≈øelves in Front and Reer of the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes: The la≈øt Rank of Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, double to the right File-wi≈øe, and move forward until your fir≈øt men exceed two foot the Front of each divi≈øion, which occa≈øioneth the next Figure.

It is now high time that we put a period to this Exerci≈øe; wherefore let the En≈øign unfurl his Colours, the Souldiers ≈øhoulder their Arms, and the Drum beat a march; upon which the En≈øign being in the mid≈øt may di≈øplay his Colours ≈øo long as ≈øhall be convenient, and after the Leader may proceed to their reducement, as followeth.

Reducement. Middle-file of Muskettiers, face about, and march cleer of your own Divi≈øions, and double to the left Rank-wi≈øe; Muskettiers, clo≈øe inward to order; Pikes, double to the right and left outward File-wi≈øe: Files, clo≈øe into the mid≈øt to order; Ranks, clo≈øe to order; Pikes, move forward and even your Front; Pikes and Muskettiers interchange ground, they are reduced.
Now the Leader may command the Muskettiers to troop away, and after he may lodge his Colours, thereby refre≈øhing both him≈øelf and his Souldiers, until the next ≈øummons by beat of the Drum.

div.head: CHAP. XV. The fourth Exerci≈øe, con≈øi≈øting of four Files eight deep.
div.p: THe Souldiers upon the fourth ≈øummons coming unto the place of Exerci≈øe, make fuller appearance then before, in≈øomuch that their Files are drawn forth eight deep; the Leaders thereof having ≈øpent ≈øome time in exerci≈øing them in each particular po≈øture, are called upon to joyn into a body; where their Leader ≈øtands, bethinking of him≈øelf what new matter he ≈øhould delight them with, there being ≈øufficient in any one particular motion for their Exerci≈øe, pitches for pre≈øent to ≈øpend his chiefe≈øt time in motions upon facing, continuing longer in them, in re≈øpect of the ≈øeveral Figures of Battail demon≈øtrated by them.

Now for the more ready performance thereof, I ≈øhall onely give the ≈øeveral words of command for each particular Figure which may be drawn from the≈øe facings, referring the Reader to the Figures them≈øelves, where I ≈øhall have occa≈øion to make u≈øe of them upon Firings, which ≈øhall be made known unto him by Alphabetical letters, pointing from each facing to the Figure it produceth. To come briefly to the exerci≈øe in hand, ≈øilence being craved, and Ranks and Files clo≈øed to order, the Leader may proceed to the≈øe or the like particular facings, producing eighteen Figures of Battail Alphabetically ≈øet forth, with their reducements.
Command. Half-files, double your front to the left.
Direction. Files, open from the right to open order; Half-files, advance your Arms, and move forward to the left, and double the Front.

Command. Files, open from the mid≈øt to open order; Muskettiers, clo≈øe outward to clo≈øe order; the inmo≈øt Files of Pikes, clo≈øe outward to clo≈øe order; Ranks, clo≈øe to Front and Reer to order, and they will ≈øtand in eight Divi≈øions.
Command. Reer-divi≈øion of Pikes, face about; Muskettiers, face outward, move all three paces, to your Leader; pointeth to the fir≈øt Figure marked by the Alphabetical letter A.

Command. Muskettiers, face inward; Divi≈øion of Pikes, face outward, march all until the Pikes are cleer three foot of the Muskettiers, to your Leader: this forms the Figure demon≈øtrated unto you by the Alphabetical B.

Command. Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the left; face about to the right;
Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the right, face to the right: Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the left, face to the left; Divi≈øions of Pikes, face to the Center; move all until your Muskettiers be cleer three foot of Front, Reer, and both Flanks; then let them ≈øtand, and face the Divi≈øions of Muskettiers to the left, and the Divi≈øion of Pikes to face about to the right, and to move all two paces; then face all to the Center, and clo≈øe their Divi≈øions a little; after face to their Leader C.
Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, ≈øtand; the re≈øt, face to the Reer, march all until your Reer-divi≈øion range even abre≈øt with tho≈øe upon the Flanks; to your Leader D.

Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, face outward, march all until the Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes be cleer of the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers; then let the Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes face to the Front; the re≈øt face to the Reer, march all three paces; to your Leader E
Command. Divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the mid≈øt, face about; march all until the Middle-divi≈øion of Muskettiers range even with the Reer; to your Leader F.

Command. Front-divi≈øions of Pikes, face to the outward Angles: Reer-divi≈øion of Pikes, face about, and after face to inward Angles of the Reer: outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face to your inward Angles: Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers, face about; as you are now faced, move all ≈øome three paces to your Leader G.
Command. Muskettiers, face to Front, Reer, and both Flanks; Divi≈øions of Pikes, face to the Center; march all until you be even abre≈øt in Front, Reer, and both Flanks; to your Leader H.
Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about; the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions, face inward; Divi≈øions of Pikes, face to the Center; march all three paces; to your Leader I.

Command. Divi≈øions of Muskettiers upon the left in the mid≈øt, and the three la≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers, to face to the Reer, and move three paces, and ≈øtand; Middle-divi≈øions, face to the left; and the re≈øt face to the right, and move three paces; to your Leader K.

Command. The four la≈øt Divi≈øions, face to the left; the four fir≈øt Divi≈øions, face to the right; move all until you be cleer one of another; then face to the right, and march until you range even abre≈øt in Front and Reer; face to your Leader L.
Command. The two inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes, ≈øtand; the re≈øt face inward; march all until the Middle-divi≈øions be three foot cleer of the Front; to your Leader M.
Command. Front-divi≈øions of Pikes, face outward; the re≈øt, face outward; march all until the Front-divi≈øions range even with the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes; face your Leader N.

Command. Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face outward; the re≈øt, face inward; march all until the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers are cleer of the Pikes; then ≈øtand, and the ≈øix la≈øt Divi≈øions to face about, and move three paces; to your Leader O.

Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face outward; march all ≈øome ≈øix paces; Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers, face to the Front; the re≈øt, face to the Reer, and move until the Reer-divi≈øions range even abre≈øt with the Front; to your Leader P.

Command. Front-divi≈øion of Pikes upon the left, face about; march all until that Divi≈øion be ≈øix foot cleer of the Reer; then ≈øtand, and Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, face to the left, and move two paces; to your Leader Q.
Command. Front-divi≈øion of Pikes, face about; march all until the Front-divi≈øion of Pikes range even abre≈øt with the fir≈øt Divi≈øion of Muskettiers; to your Leader R.

Command. The two outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about; outmo≈øt
divi≈øions of Pikes, face outward; move all until the outmo≈øt Muskettiers ≈øtand ≈øtreight with the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers; then face to your Learder S.

Reducement. Divi≈øions of Pikes, face inward; the three la≈øt Divi≈øions, face about: march all ≈øome ≈øix paces; Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, face to the left: Muskettiers, face about; move all two paces; to your Leader: Divi≈øions, move forwards, and double your Front; clo≈øe Files inward to order, and Ranks forward to order; double Files to the left intire advancing, reduceth them.

Thus much, I conceive may be ≈øufficient at one time for a Leader to exerci≈øe his Company with the motions upon their Facings, ≈øo that he ≈øhall not need to trouble him≈øelf with any more then Firings: Where fir≈øt, as is mo≈øt propere≈øt, we will begin with ≈øome plain Firings to the Front; for the performance whereof, let the Half-files double their Front to the left; and Ranks and Files, clo≈øe forwards and inward to order.
The fir≈øt firing. Let them Fire by Divi≈øions drawn forth ten or twentie paces, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers clo≈øe their Divi≈øions before the Front of Pikes, and give Fire, and fall all off upon the right Flank.

The third firing The Body moving or marching, let the outmo≈øt Files face to the right, and give Fire, and lead away by the contrary ≈øide of their Pikes, by the Leaders of the File; the next File may do the ≈øame, and con≈øequently all the re≈øt until all have Fired; then let them face to the right; the Pikes in the interim charging on whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again

The fourth firing. Let the Pikes open from the mid≈øt, that the Muskettiers may come up between them: two Ranks may kneel down, and the other two ≈øtand upright, and Fire altogether; the Pikes then charging, and after retreating, they may clo≈øe again into the mid≈øt, continuing their A≈øpects to the right Flank; the Pikes may port, and the Muskettiers may ≈ølieve up upon the right and left of the Pikes; the fir≈øt Rank giving Fire, and pre≈øently falling before the Front of Pikes; the next Rank doing the ≈øame, falling ≈øtill behind their own Muskettiers, and before the Front of Pikes, as they are then faced; and having all Fired after that manner, they may Fire again, and flank their Pikes; then facing to Front and Reer, they may give Fire to both places, and fall off to the right and left, and Flank their pikes from Front and Reer; and after face to their Leader.

Command. Files, open outward to open order; Muskettiers, clo≈øe outward to order, the inmo≈øt Files of pikes, clo≈øe outward to order; Ranks, clo≈øe to Front and Reer to order; Reer-divi≈øions of pikes, face about; Muskettiers, face outward; move all three paces; to your Leader. And now you have the Figure of battail pointed out in the fir≈øt place unto you by the Alphabet.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them Fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right into the place of tho≈øe Muskettiers in the Reer, they at
the ≈øame time moving up into the Front, firing in like manner, and moving down into their places again.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Reer-divi≈øions face about; and after let them give Fire both to Front and Reer; and falling in the Reer of them≈øelves, the Pikes may charge while the Muskettiers make ready again: they may Fire a ≈øecond time in the ≈øame manner.

The third firing. Face all to both Flanks; then let them give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes after charging on three paces, and the Muskettiers retreating three paces; after facing to their Leader, produceth this Figure following.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the two fir≈øt Divi≈øions advance three paces before the Front give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after move down into the places of them in the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving up into their rooms, giving Fire, in like manner falling down into their places again: this may be perform'd twice over; after face them to Front and Reer.

The ≈øecond firing. Let them give Fire, their Divi≈øions advancing three paces before the Front and Reer, falling in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes charging on, and the Muskettiers retreating into their places again, facing to their Leader.

Command. Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the left, face about; Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the right, face to the right; Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the left, face to the left: Muskettiers, march all cleer of the Pikes, then ≈øtand; after face them in their ≈øeveral Divi≈øions to the left, and move two paces; to your Leader.

If you finde by the words of Command given to make the former Figure, that your Divi≈øions ≈øtand too thin; you may face them all to the Center, and move forward every Divi≈øion two or three paces; then face to their Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after wheel off to the right into the room or place of them in the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving up into the Front, Firing and falling off in like manner: this Firing may be performed twice.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers upon the Wings advance forward three paces; give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after face about, and move into their places.

The third firing. Let the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers move to the right two paces; Reer-divi≈øion, move up upon the left of them; then let them all both in Front and Reer give Fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes after clo≈øing forward, their Divi≈øions may charge on, and after retreating into their places again, the Divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the left in the Front in the mean ≈øpace facing about, and moving down into their places.

The fourth firing. Let the Muskettiers face to the Front, Reer, and both Flanks; the Pikes, face to the outward Angles of Front and Reer, and Port; then let them give Fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves: Pikes may charge on to the four Angles; then ordering all their Arms, move the Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers forward even with them of the Wings; then face all to their Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt divi≈øion Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after face about, and move down into the Middle-rank of Muskettiers; they at the ≈øame time marching up into their ground, Firing, and falling off in like manner.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Muskettiers upon the Wings advance forward, even abre≈øt with tho≈øe in the Front, and Fire altogether; the three Divi≈øions falling in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions facing about, and moving into their places again.

The third firing. Let the Front-Divi≈øion of Muskettiers face about, move down, and double the middlemo≈øt by divi≈øion; after let the Muskettiers face outward, and move three paces, and give Fire to both the Flanks, falling off to the right and left; the middle-divi≈øions making good their ground, and firing in like manner, falling off.

Having Fired twice over to both the Flanks, face them to their Leader, and draw forth the outmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers of the middle-divi≈øion before the Front of Pikes, and clo≈øe their Files inward to Order.
Command. Reer-divi≈øion of Pikes, face outward, and move two foot cleer of the ≈øtanding part; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt divi≈øion of Muskettiers give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after wheel about, and fall in the mid≈øt of the Reer, and range even abre≈øt between the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Pikes; after face to their Leader.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the three other divi≈øions advance forwards altogether three foot before the Front, and give Fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes charge on, and the Muskettiers ≈øtill pre≈øerving their ground, making ready again whil≈øt the Pikes retreat into their places.

The third firing. Let them give Fire again in like manner; the Pikes charging on, and retreating as before; then let the la≈øt divi≈øions of Pikes move inward in a ≈øtreight line with the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Front, and they will ≈øtand as followeth.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them give Fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves: this may be performed twice; then face to the Front and Reer; the la≈øt Rank of the middle-divi≈øion is to face about; the fir≈øt Rank are to continue their A≈øpects unto the Front.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Pikes port to Front and Reer, and the Muskettiers give Fire to Front and Reer, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after the Pikes may charge on, and retreat again: they may continue this Figure twice, the Pikes charging; and after face to their Leader.

Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, face about, and move three paces, and face to their Leader; Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about, and move down into
the mid≈øt, as before, interchanging ground with the Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers: the two la≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes move outward, until they be two foot clear of the next range of Muskettiers; middle Divi≈øion of Muskettiers move backward even with the Reer Divi≈øion of Muskettiers; to your Leader.

Upon this Figure face the three la≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers to the right about, and let them give fire to Front and Reer, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, the Pikes may afterwards charge on to Front and Reer: and retreat back again into their fir≈øt places; they may perform this firing twice, the Pikes likewi≈øe charging up before, and retreating into their places again; face all to their Leader.
And now it will be expedient, having almo≈øt tired the Muskettiers with the≈øe ≈øeveral Firings, to end our fourth Exerci≈øe, and lodge the Colours; but fir≈øt we will reduce them.

Reducement. The outmo≈øt Divi≈øion of Muskettiers on the right, move forward, and fall in the Reer of them in the Front: Reer Divi≈øion of Muskettiers move forward, and fall in the Reer of the left Divi≈øion of Muskettiers, then let them move ≈øtraight forwards and joyn with them in the Front, and clo≈øe the Pikes into the mid≈øt to Order, and their Ranks forward to Order; let the Pikes double the Front inward entire, and after Files to double to the left entire, advancing, clo≈øing Files inward to Order; they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XVI. The Fifth Exerci≈øe, with four Files Eight deep.
div.p: THe Souldiers having made timely appearance according to the Drums ≈øummoning unto ≈øuch places as was appointed by their Commander, and being by the Serjeants drawn forth into Files, the Leaders thereof being permitted to in≈øtruct and teach their Files the Po≈øtures, and hand≈øome handling of their Arms, are forthwith by warning of the Drum to lead up their Files, and being joyn'd in a Body, according to the di≈øcretion of the Superior Officers, do there ≈øtand, ≈øilently expecting what will follow. The Captain, or other that ≈øhall Exerci≈øe them, fir≈øt commands the Bringers-up to double their Front to the left, and after appoints one of the Serjeants to fetch the Colours; to which purpo≈øe he draws off the two inmo≈øt Files of Pikes; and advancing their Arms, the Drum beating a troop, they may move away, and bring them to the Company, being led thither by the En≈øign, the Serjeant falling in the Reer of the Pikes; and they falling into their places again, they may be commanded, Files to double their depth to the right, every man falling behind his Bringer-up. Now the former days Exerci≈øe being chiefly ≈øpent in the Motions by ≈øeveral Firings, they may be ≈øpar'd in this, and in lieu thereof the Leader may out of the former plain Doublings collect one that may continue long in exerci≈øe before reduced, and in this Exerci≈øe he ≈øhall not need to trouble him≈øelf with Counter-marches or Wheelings, but fall immediately alone upon the Motions with this Doubling or the like, as followeth.

div.head: CHAP. XVII. Thirty ≈øeveral Doublings, with their Reducements.
div.p: Command. HAlf-files double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the right entire, advancing.
Command. Half-files double your Front to the right and left outward.
Direction. Half-files advance your Arms, and move to the right and left outward, and double the Front.
Command. Double your Files outward entire, advancing.
Direction. Even files from the Flanks move forward and double the odd, and after clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Half-files double your Front to the right entire.
Command. Right Half-ranks double the left Flank to the right.
Direction. Face to the left, right half-ranks move forward, and double the left Flank to the right; to your Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks to the right entire.
Command. Right half-ranks double your left Flank entire, advancing.
Command. Half-files double your Front inward entire.
Command Left half-ranks double your right Flank to the left.
Direction. Face to the right, left half-ranks advance your Arms, and move forward to the left, and double your right Flank.
Command. Double your Ranks to the left entire.
Command. Left half-ranks double your right Flank entire, advancing.
Command. Half-files double your Front inward entire.
Direction. Front half-files face outward, and march clear of the ≈øtanding part; to your Leader; half-files move forward, and double the Front inward entire.
Command. Right half-ranks double entire the depth of the left Flank.
Direction. Left half-ranks ≈øtand, right half-ranks face about, and march clear of the ≈øtanding part; then face to the right, and move forward even with the left Flank; to your Leader.
Command. Front half-files double the Reer to the left entire.
Direction. Front half-files face to the right, march clear of the ≈øtanding part, face all to the Reer; Front half-files move down, and double the Reer to the left.
Command. Right half-ranks double your left Flank to the left.
Direction. Face all to the left right; half-ranks move forward, and double the left Flank to the left; to your Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks to the left entire into the Reer.
Direction. Face all to the Reer, and every even Rank from the Reer move forth, and double the odd; to your Leader, and clo≈øe forward to Order.
Command. The two outmo≈øt Files upon each Flank double entire, advancing the four inmo≈øt Files.
Command. Front half-files double the Reer to the right entire.
Command. Right half-ranks double your left Flank inward entire.

Direction. Half-files of the left half-ranks face about; left half-ranks move clear of the ≈øtanding part; face all to the left: right half-ranks move forwards, and double the left Flank inward entire.
Command. The four middle ranks double your Front and Reer inward entire.

Direction. Half-files face about, the two fir≈øt and the two la≈øt Ranks open outward, until you be clear of the ≈øtanding part, then the four middle Ranks move forward two to the Front and two to the Reer, doubling entire to both places; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe your Divi≈øions.
Command. The two outmo≈øt Files upon each Flank, double the four middlemo≈øt Files by Divi≈øion.
Direction. Half-files of the two outmo≈øt Files face about, outmo≈øt Files move clear of the ≈øtanding part, then clo≈øe inward to Order, and face to your Leader.
Command. The two fir≈øt, and the two la≈øt Ranks double the four middlemo≈øt Ranks inward entire.

Direction. The four middle Ranks face outward, and move clear of the ≈øtanding part; then face to your Leader: the two fir≈øt Ranks face about, move forward with the two la≈øt, doubling the middlemo≈øt inward entire; to your Leader.
Command. The four inmo≈øt Files double entire, advancing the two outmo≈øt Files.

Direction. The two outmo≈øt Files ≈øtand, the inmo≈øt Files move forward clear of the ≈øtanding part; then face outward, and move ≈øtraight with the outmo≈øt Files; to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Front half-files double the Reer by Divi≈øion.
Direction. The four middle Files double the two outmo≈øt Files inward entire.

Direction. Half-files of the two outmo≈øt Files face about, outmo≈øt files move forward clear of the ≈øtanding part, face all to the right and left outward; inmo≈øt Files move forward, and double the outmo≈øt inward entire; to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Front half-files double your Reer to the left.
Command. Files, double your Depth to the right.
Command. The two fir≈øt and the two la≈øt Ranks double the four middle Ranks by Divi≈øion.

Direction. The two fir≈øt and the two la≈øt Ranks face outward, and march clear of the ≈øtanding part; then face inward, and move forward, doubling the inmo≈øt Files by Divi≈øion; face to your Leader.
Command. The two outmo≈øt Files upon each Flank double entire the Depth of the four inmo≈øt Files, reduceth.

div.head: CHAP. XVIII. Plain Firings and Figures of Battail.
div.p: HAving pa≈ø≈øed over the≈øe Motions of Doublings, in the next place we will proceed to Firings; command therefore Files to open from the mid≈øt to open Order, and after let the Bringers-up double the Front to the left.
The first firing. Let the Muskettiers give fire even in the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank give fire, and fall in between the Pikes, every Rank doing the ≈øame until all have fired; then let the fir≈øt Rank move forth by Divi≈øion, give fire to the Front, and fall in again, every rank doing the ≈øame.

The third firing. Let them face to both Flanks and give fire, and fall off to the right and left, and flank their Pikes to Front and Reer: the Pikes may now port, and move all forward three paces; the Muskettiers may give fire again, and fall in the Reer of the Pikes, the Pikes charging on, and after retreating to their fir≈øt ground may charge at foot, and the Muskettiers may give fire by two Ranks all together over their heads; after recovering their Arms, let them face to Front and Reer, and let the Muskettiers move forth clear of the ≈øtanding part, then ≈øtand and give fire to Front and Reer, and fall off to the right and left, and flank the Pikes, who after may charge on to Front and Reer; then retreating, face all to their Leader.

Command. Half-files of Pikes face about, Muskettiers face outward, march all three paces; Pikes face to the right and left; Muskettiers face about to the right, march all three paces; then let the la≈øt Rank face about, the fir≈øt and the la≈øt Rank double File-wi≈øe inward, advancing; Pikes face to the outward Angles of Front and Reer; Muskettiers face to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and move all two paces; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt Divi≈øion of Muskettiers fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after wheel off to the Right, moving down into the place of the Reer Divi≈øion, who may at the ≈øame time move forward into their ground, and fire in like manner, wheeling off as the former did.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the two outmo≈øt Divi≈øions move forward into the Front, give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after move down into their places.
The third firing. Face all to the Reer, and let the Muskettiers give fire there in the ≈øame manner as they did to the Front.

The fourth firing. Let the Muskettiers face to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and the Pikes face to the outward Angles of Front and Reer, then let the Muskettiers move forth three foot clear of the Pikes, and fire to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and fall in the reer of them≈øelves, after facing about, move into their places again.
The fifth firing. Let them face as before, and give fire on the ≈øame ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes may after charge on, and retreat into their places again.
Command. Muskettiers move forth, and range even abre≈øt with the Pikes into Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt, and they will ≈øtand in a ≈øquare as followeth.

The first firing. Upon this Figure as they are faced to Front, Reer and both Flanks, and the Pikes to the outward Angles of Front and Reer, it will be be≈øt to fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and to fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes may after charge to the four Angles.

The ≈øecond firing. Let them double their Ranks outward, and give fire; after face about and move three paces into the mid≈øt of Pikes, and having made ready again, let them face about, and move forward and fire as they did before, and after di≈ømount their Muskets, taking them in both hands, they may, as occa≈øion ≈øhall require, make u≈øe of the Butt end thereof again≈øt the Hor≈øe, and the Pikes may ≈øtand upon their charge.

The third firing. Let the Muskettiers double inward File-wi≈øe, the Pikes keep their A≈øpects to the four Angles, the Musketttiers, as before, may give Fire to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and fall in the reer of tho≈øe Pikes next their right hand; and having their A≈øpects unto the ≈øame Angles, they may fire there, if they plea≈øe, by way of Extraduction, and move forth to the left into their places again; then let the Pikes face to the Front, and Muskettiers upon the wings face about to the right, and Muskettiers move forward three paces; face to your Leader forms the following Figure.

The first firing. Let the fir≈øt Divi≈øion give fire together, and wheel off into the Reer, the next two Divi≈øions moving forward into their ground, giving fire all together, and wheeling off to the right and left into the Reer, the re≈øt ≈øtill moving forward until the Reer-divi≈øion is likewi≈øe come up into the Front, and gives fire in like manner, and falling off to the right into his fir≈øt place again; this firing may be continued twice.

The ≈øecond firing. Let them give fire all together to the Front after this manner; let the middle Divi≈øions move forth to the right and left clear of the Pikes, the Reer-divi≈øion at the ≈øame time moving forward upon the out≈øide of tho≈øe in the Front, and give fire and move into their places again, making ready while≈øt the Pikes clo≈øe forward, and charge on five or ≈øix paces, they may retreat again into their places.

The third firing. Let them face all to the Reer, and fire after this manner, the fir≈øt Divi≈øion kneel down, the middle Divi≈øions move forth clear of the Pikes; the Front-divi≈øion marching down into the Reer, may give fire all together, the outmo≈øt Divi≈øion and the Front-divi≈øion over the heads of them in the Reer, and move in, and back again into their places; then face to their Leader.

Command. The outmo≈øt Divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the left in the mid≈øt, and the three la≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers face about; march all three paces, and ≈øtand: Middle Divi≈øions face to the left, and move two paces; face all to your Leader: Divi≈øions of Pikes face inward; Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers, and the ≈øecond from the Reer face about, and move little, and clo≈øe your Divi≈øions; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt Divi≈øion give fire and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, then wheel down into the Reer, the other Divi≈øions ≈øucce≈ø≈øively moving up into the Front, and firing in like manner; this firing may be continued twice over.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Divi≈øions of Muskettiers double their Ranks to the right and left outward, and give fire in ≈øingle Ranks as they did before, until all have fired twice over.

The third firing. Let them double their Files to the right and left inward, and the Reer Divi≈øions to face about, then let them give fire both to Front and Reer, falling fir≈øt in the Reer of them≈øelves; after to wheel off into the mid≈øt, and facing to Front and Reer, the middle Divi≈øions may move forth into their ground, firing in like manner; the Pikes may after charge while≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again, and after retreating into their places, they may continue their firing, as formerly, the Pikes charging on as before.

The fourth firing. Let each Divi≈øion of Muskettiers double Ranks outward, and fire to Front and Reer, and to wheel off in one ≈øingle rank to the right and left, and rank again in the mid≈øt, and after double inward File-wi≈øe, and face to their Leader.

Command. The four la≈øt Divi≈øions face to the left, the four fir≈øt Divi≈øions face to the right; march all until you be clear one of another; then face to the right, and move until you be even abre≈øt in Front and Reer; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt Divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, after wheeling off to the right and left into the Reer, they at the ≈øame time moving forwards into their places, firing and falling off in like manner; they may perform the ≈øame firing to the Reer, being thither faced.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Reer-Divi≈øions move to the right and left outward, clear of the ≈øtanding part; then face to the Front, move up even abre≈øt with the Front-Divi≈øions, and let every Divi≈øion fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes may charge, and after both they and the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions may move down into their places.
Command. The inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes advance forward three foot before the Front, the re≈øt face inward, and move two paces; to your Leader.

Upon this Figure let the fir≈øt Ranks of the Front-Divi≈øion fire, and fall behind the Front-Divi≈øions of Pikes; the next rank may fire and fall behind the fir≈øt, then let the Reer-divi≈øion move up and give fire, and fall in the reer of them≈øelves; and after wheel about to the right and left inward, moving down clear of the reer, and facing again unto their Leader: then they may fire a ≈øecond time in the ≈øame way, the Front-divi≈øions moving forth and firing fir≈øt, and falling behind the Pikes, the reer-divi≈øions coming up into their places, firing and falling off again by wheeling about inward, until they be clear three foot of the reer; then facing to their Leader, they will ≈øtand as followeth, where the En≈øign may di≈øplay his Colours, if the Leader plea≈øeth to march upon it.

Having now ≈øpent much time in the≈øe particular Firings, it will be convenient to give the Souldiers ≈øome re≈øpit to refre≈øh their almo≈øt tired ≈øpirits, that they may more chearfully appear upon the next ≈øummons of the Drum; and therefore we will conclude this Exerci≈øe, and prepare for the lodging of the Colours.

Reducement. Reer-Divi≈øions of Pikes move ≈øtraight forward, until you range even abre≈øt with the Front-Divi≈øions of Pikes; Reer-Divi≈øions of Muskettiers move forward, and range inward even abre≈øt with the Front-Divi≈øions; Files, clo≈øe into the mid≈øt to Order; Front and Reer half-files, open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance; the four inmo≈øt Files of Front and Reer half-files face inward and interchange ground; then let each two Files of Pikes clo≈øe outward to Order, and after to double their Divi≈øions to the right File-wi≈øe, and to clo≈øe Files to the left to Order; the two outmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers upon the right double Ranks inward, and lead them away before the left half-ranks of Muskettiers; the next two Files double Ranks outward, and lead them away behind the Reer by fir≈øt facing them about; Pikes face to the left, and move ≈øtraight before the Muskettiers, and then double the Reer inward entire; after Files to double their Depth to the right, every man falling behind his Bringer-up; they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XVIII. The Sixth Exerci≈øe, with four Files eight deep.
div.p: THe Souldiers being met at the place appointed, and their Files being drawn forth according to the u≈øual cu≈øtom, the Leaders being to ≈øhew each Souldier how to handle and u≈øe his Arms, and after leads up their Files, and joyns them into a Body, where the Commander having ≈øent for his Colours, ≈øtands at the head of them, commanding their ≈øilence and attention to the words of Command. Now having in his former Exerci≈øe ≈øpent mo≈øt of the time upon plain Doublings, he may in this ≈øhew unto them the great variety of Doublings by Counter-marches; and although they are very difficult, yet they will afford much delight and content unto the Souldiers.

div.head: GHAP. XIX. Thirty Doublings by Counter-marches, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. BRingers-up, double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the left entire advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Front half-files double your Reer to the right and left outward, following your Leaders.
Command. Double your Files outward entire, advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Bringers-up, double your front to the right and left inward.
Command. Double your Files inward entire, advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Front half-files double your Reer to the right and left inwards, following your Leaders.
Command. Files, double your depth to the right and left outward, following your Bringers-up.
Command. Double your files to the right by Divi≈øion, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader and his Bringer-up.
Direction. Half-files of the even files from the right, face about; even files advance forward, and double the odd according to command; to your Leader.
Command. The four fir≈øt, and the four la≈øt Ranks, double the eight middlemo≈øt Ranks to the right and left inward, following your Leaders & your Bringers-up.

Direction. The four fir≈øt, and the four la≈øt Ranks advance your Arms, and the File-leaders and the Bringers-up begin the Motion, the re≈øt are to follow; after order their Arms, and face to their Leader.
Command. Double your files to the left by Divi≈øion, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader and his Bringer-up.
Direction. The eight middle ranks double your Front and Reer to the right and left outward, following the Half-file-leaders, and the Bringers-up of the Front half-files.

Direction. The four la≈øt ranks of the Front and Reer half-files face about: the middle are to begin this Motion, and to advance their Arms, and to turn off to the right and left, every rank following them until they have doubled the Front and Reer: then face all to the Front, order their Arms, and clo≈øe their Divi≈øions forward to open Order.
Command. Double your files inward by Divi≈øion, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader and his Bringer-up.

Direction. Half-files of the outmo≈øt Files face about, the outmo≈øt Files advance your Arms and move forward, placing your ≈øelves before your Leaders and your Bringers up; face to your Leader, and order your Arms.
Command. The four fir≈øt, and the four la≈øt Ranks, double the eight middlemo≈øt Ranks to the right and left outward, following your Leaders and your Bringers-up.
Direction. The four fir≈øt, and the four la≈øt Ranks, advance your Arms, and move away to the right and left, and double the eight middlemo≈øt Ranks; to your Leader.
Command. Front half-files, double your Reer to the right, following your Leaders.
Command. Files, double your Depth to the right, every man placing him≈øelf behind his Bringer-up.
Command. Right half-ranks, double your left Flank to the right, following your right-hand-men.
Direction. Face outward, and right half-ranks turn off to the left, and double the left Flank to the right; to your Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks to the right entire, every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øide of his right-hand-man.
Command. Left half-ranks, double your right Flank to the left, following your left-hand-men.
Command. Double your ranks to the left entire, every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øide of his left-hand-man.
Command. Double your Ranks by Divi≈øion, every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øide of his left-hand-man.
Command. The inmo≈øt Files double the outmo≈øt Files, placing your≈øelves on the out≈øide of your right and left-hand-men.

Direction. The inmo≈øt Files advance your Arms, face outward, and move forward, and double the outmo≈øt Files, placing your ≈øelves on the out≈øide of your right and left-hand-men; order your Arms, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to open Order.
Command. Double your Ranks by divi≈øion into the Reer.
Command. The two outmo≈øt Files, double the four inmo≈øt by following of your out≈øide-men.
Direction. The inmo≈øt Files, face inward; the re≈øt face outward, and turn off to the right and left toward the Reer; and double the four inmo≈øt Files; to your Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks by Divi≈øion into Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt; every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øide of his right and left-hand-man.

Direction. The two la≈øt Ranks of the Front and Reer-half-files, face about; even Ranks from the Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt; advance your Arms, and face outward, and move forth, and double the Front, Reer, and Mid≈øt of Ranks, placing your ≈øelves on the out≈øide of your right and left-hand-men; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks forward to open Order.
Command. Double your two outmo≈øt Files to the right and left outward, and Mid≈øt, following of the inmo≈øt Files.

Direction. The two outmo≈øt Files, face outward; the re≈øt face inward; and Front and Reer-half-files di≈øtinctly turn off to the right and left, and double the outmo≈øt Files to the right and left outward; and Mid≈øt following of the inmo≈øt Files; to your Leader: Files, clo≈øe into the mid≈øt to Order.
Command. Double your Files to the right intire advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Bringers-up, double your Front to the right.
Command. File-leaders, double your Reer to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the left intire into the Reer, every man placing him≈øelf before his Bringer-up.
Direction. Face to the Reer, and even Files from the left; advance your Arms, and move forward, and double the odd, placing your ≈øelves before your Bringers-up; to your Leader.
Command. Files, double your depth to the left, following your Bringers-up.
Command. Half-files, double your Front to the right and left inward, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader, they are reduced as at fir≈øt.

div.head: CHAP. XX. Plain Firings, and Figures of Battail.
div.p: HAving ≈øpent ≈øo much time upon the≈øe Doublings by Counter-marches, in the next place I ≈øhall proceed to Firings, and ≈øeveral Figures of Battail; where fir≈øt command the Half-files to double the Front to the left, and then go on to your Firings.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them fire even with the Front, and fall off, and Rank even with the Half-files, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes may after charge on, and the Muskettiers may give fire again, and fall in the Reer of the Pikes.
The ≈øecond firing. Let the Pikes port, and the Muskettiers give fire by extraduction.

The third firing. Now the Muskettiers being upon the Reer, fire them there upon the march; wheel them about to the right, and let them fire after this manner: face about to the right and left; let the la≈øt Rank fire, fall off, and Flank the fir≈øt Rank of Pikes; and ≈øo con≈øequently all the re≈øt; after fire them to the Reer, and fall off to the right and left ≈øome ≈øix paces before the Front of Pikes, and in the Reer of them≈øelves; then face the body about, and let the Pikes charge to the Reer, and after port; the Muskettiers may give fire to the Reer by way of extraduction.
The fourth firing. Next fire to the Reer by dividing the Muskettiers, and bringing them even with the Reer, and ranking outward, and falling again as they were; face to your Leader.

Command. Ranks and Files, open to your open Order; Muskettiers, clo≈øe outward to Order; the outmo≈øt Files of Pikes, ≈øtand; the re≈øt clo≈øe outward to Order: Front-half-files, open forward three paces: Ranks, clo≈øe to Front and Reer to Order: Pikes, move forward two paces; Pikes, face outward; Muskettiers, face inward, and move cleer one of another; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them give Fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right and left into the Reer, they at the ≈øame time moving up into their ground, give Fire, and falling off as before; the Pikes may after charge on while the Muskettiers make ready.

The ≈øecond firing. Let Pikes and Muskettiers Rank outward and give Fire, and fall off in like manner, as before; after let them Fire, and fall in the Reer of the fir≈øt Rank of Pikes of the Front-divi≈øions; then the Pikes may port; then let the fir≈øt Divi≈øions give Fire, and fall in behind the Pikes; the Reer-divi≈øions after moving up into their places, may give Fire, and face about; march down into their places; then face to their Leader: This firing being continued twice or oftener over, you may fire them to the Reer (they being thither faced) after the very ≈øame manner, the Pikes there charging; after facing all to their Leader, let them double Files to the right and left inward of each divi≈øion.
Command. Front-divi≈øions of Pikes, face outward; Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face outward; the re≈øt face about; move all ≈øix paces; to your Leader; Reer-divi≈øions, move forward two paces.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right and left into the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving forward into their places may give fire, and fall off as before: this may be twice performed.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of the Front-divi≈øions of Pikes; the Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers moving into their ground, firing, and falling behind the Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes; then they may move forth cleer of the Pikes, and fire, and fall in again: they may fire after the ≈øame manner to the Reer: But I ≈øhall let that pa≈øs, and go on to the next.
