Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face outward, and march three paces cleer of the Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes; then face to your Leader, and move forward until they range even abre≈øt with the Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers give fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after wheel off to the right and left into the room of them in the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving up into their places, firing and falling off in like manner: this firing may be continued twice over; then the Pikes may charge whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Reer-divi≈øions move forward even abre≈øt; then let the Muskettiers give fire altogether, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves: this firing may be continued twice over, and the Pikes may charge; after let tho≈øe Divi≈øions that moved, march down again into their places.
Command. Front-divi≈øions of Pikes upon the left, face about, and move down four paces cleer of the Reer; Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, move to the left two paces, to your Leader.

Upon the former Figure fire fir≈øt to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel down into the place of them in the Reer, they at the ≈øame time moving up into their places, firing and falling off in like manner. This firing being twice performed, let the Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers move up even abre≈øt with the Front-divi≈øions, and fire altogether, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after let the Pikes charge on, and the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers face about, and move down into their places.
Command. Front-divi≈øion of Pikes, face about, and march until they range even abre≈øt with the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers; to your Leader; Reer-divi≈øion of Pikes move forward three paces.

Upon this Figure let each divi≈øion fire as they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, performing it twice over; the Pikes may charge on, whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again, who after may give fire by two Ranks together, as they ≈øtand in each divi≈øion; the Pikes charging as before.

Command. Outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about, march until you range even with the Reer; face inward, and move until you ≈øtand ≈øtreight after the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers; to your Leader: middle-divi≈øions of Pikes, face outward, and move cleer of the ≈øtanding part; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them give fire to the Front, by divi≈øions relieving each other; after face them to both Flanks, and let them give fire upon the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves: This firing may be continued twice; and after the Pikes may charge on, whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again; and after retreating into their places.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the middle-divi≈øion of Pikes in the Reer, face about; and the middle-divi≈øion of Pikes, face to the Front; and Muskettiers to face to the outward Angles of Front and Reer; and let them give fire to the four Angles, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, or fire altogether; and the Pikes may after charge on to Front, Reer and both Flanks, being all faced unto tho≈øe places; and retreating again to their places, they may, if they plea≈øe, fire a ≈øecond time, and charge on in manner as before. Now if the Leader have a de≈øire to fire to Front and Reer, let him face them thither, and let them fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes after charging on, and retreating again into their places; face them all to their Leader, and open the Front and Reer-divi≈øions from the mid≈øt to ≈øufficient di≈øtance, and let the En≈øign di≈øplay his Colours.

Reducement. Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, advance forward unto the left into the Front; outmo≈øt divi≈øion of Pikes, face inward, march and clo≈øe your divi≈øions; Muskettiers in the Reer, move and clo≈øe Ranks forward to Order; Files, double your depth to the right, every man falling behind his Bringer-up, reduceth them.

Then let the Muskettiers poy≈øe their Muskets, if they be neer the place of lodging the Colours, and to move unto that place making a guard; their Muskets being re≈øted, after which the Colours being furled up, and the Pikes advanced; the Leader being on the right hand, and the Lieutenant on the left, and the En≈øign in the mid≈øt; the Serjeants following them, and in the Reer of them the Drums beating a troop; let them march away and lodge the Colours, the Muskettiers giving of a volley, they may all betake them≈øelves unto their ≈øeveral habitations, until they ≈øhall be ≈øummon'd again by beat of the Drum unto their place of Rendezvous.

div.head: CHAP. XXI. The ≈øeventh Exerci≈øe, con≈øi≈øting of ≈øixty four men, eight Files eight deep.
div.p:
THe Souldiers appearing unto the place of Exerci≈øe, according unto the appointment of their Leader, or accu≈øtomed thereunto by beat of Drum, are drawn forth into ≈øeveral Files, as is the u≈øual cu≈øtom. And the Souldiers being in≈øtructed of the u≈øe and handling of their Arms, by the Serjeants, Corporals,
or Leaders of the Files, ≈øpending ≈øuch time therein as ≈øhall be convenient until the fetching of the Colours; to which purpo≈øe they draw up their Files, and joyn into a Body, doubling the Front to the left by the Half-files, and ≈øend for the Colours. Which being brought unto the head of the Company, and the Souldiers returned unto their ≈øeveral places, and that the Body is clo≈øed in Rank and File to clo≈øe Order; then ≈øilence, and the well minding of their Directions, and their obedience is required of them, being three main properties belonging unto every Souldier. Now for more variety ≈øake in matter of Motions; the Leader may ≈øpend his chiefe≈øt time in Doublings, by Wheelings, giving upon all occa≈øions, the Souldiers their due di≈øtance unto every word of Command, and in≈øtructing them with their ≈øeveral rea≈øons and u≈øes, and ≈øo proceed to this that follows.

div.head: CHAP. XXII. Two and twenty ≈øeveral Doublings by Wheelings, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. WHeel off your Reer-half-files, and double your Front by divi≈øion.
Direction. Half-files, face to the Reer, and wheel about to the right and left, until you come up even with the Front.
Command. Right and left Half-ranks, double the Depth of the Battail, by wheeling into the Front.
Direction. Right-half-ranks, wheel to the left; Left-half-ranks, wheel to the right; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel off your Front-half-files, and double the Reer by Divi≈øion.
Direction. Half-files, face to the Reer; and Front-half-files, wheel about to the right and left, and move down even with the Reer; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel off your right Half-ranks, and double the left Flank to the right intire.
Direction. Face outward; and right Half-ranks, wheel about to the left, and double the left Flank to the right intire; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel off your right Half-ranks, and double your left Flank by divi≈øion.
Direction. Face outward; and right Half-ranks, wheel about to the right and and let, and double the left Flank by Divi≈øion; to your Leader.
Command. Front and Reer-half-files, double the length of your Battail, by wheeling into the left Flank.
Direction. Face to the left; and Front-half-files that were, wheel to the left; Reer-half-files, wheel to the right; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel of your Left-half-ranks, and double your right Flank by divi≈øion.
Command. Front and Reer-half-files, double the length of the Battail by wheeling into the right Flank.
Command. Wheel your Left-half-ranks inward into the mid≈øt, and double the right Flank inward intire.

Direction. Front and Reer-half-files, open from the mid≈øt to more then double di≈øtance; after face outward; and Left-half-ranks, wheel inward into the mid≈øt, and move forward, and double the right Flank inward intire; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel off your Front-half-files, and double the Reer to the right intire.
Direction. Half-files, face to the Reer; and Front-half-files, wheel about to the left, and move down upon the right into the Reer, and face to your Leader.
Command. Wheel your Right-half-ranks inward into the mid≈øt, and double your left Flank inward intire.
Command. Wheel off the Front-half-files, and double the Reer to the left intire.
Command. Wheel your Reer-half-files inward into the mid≈øt, and double your Front inward intire.

Direction. Right and Left-half-ranks, open from the mid≈øt to more then double di≈øtance; and Half-files, face about, and wheel inward into the mid≈øt, and move forward, and double your Front inward intire.
Command. Right and left Half-ranks, double the Depth of your Battail, by wheeling into the Reer.
Direction. Face to the Reer; and right-half-ranks, wheel to the left; and left-half-ranks, wheel to the right until you meet; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel your Front-half-files inward into the mid≈øt, and double the Reer inward intire.
Command. Wheel off your left-half-ranks, and double your right Flank to the right intire. Face outward.
Command. Wheel off your Reer-half-files, and double the Front to the left intire. Half-files, face about.
Command. Wheel off your Left-half-ranks, and double your right Flank to the left intire.
Command. Wheel off your Reer-half-files, and double your Front to the right intire. Face outward.
Command. Wheel off your Left-half-ranks, and double intire the Depth of the right Flank.
Direction. Left-half-ranks, face to the left, and wheel about to the left, until you come down in the Reer of the right Flank; to your Leader.
Command. Wheel off your Reer-half-files, and double the Length of your Front to the right.
Direction. Half-files, face about, and wheel round to the left, and move forward, and double the length of the Front to the right, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXIII. Several Firings, and Figures of Battail, with ≈øixty four men.
div.p: HAving pa≈ø≈øed over the≈øe ≈øeveral Wheelings by way of Doublings, it will be ≈øufficient time to proceed unto Firings; wherefore, fir≈øt, command to open their Files from the mid≈øt to open Order; and the Bringers-up thereof to double the Front to the right and left inward.
The fir≈øt firing. Let them fire to the Front, by Ranks ranking outward, and after to rank as they were.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them give fire to the Front, by ranks ranking inward, and ranking again as they were, and clo≈øing again to the Body of Pikes.
The third firing. Let the Half-files face about; and let them give fire to Front and Reer by Ranks ranking outward, and ranking in again as they were.

The fourth firing. Let them advance forwards by two Ranks, ≈øome ten paces before the Front and Reer, and give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then face about, and fall before the Front and Reer of Pikes; and then fire again, falling off to the right and left, and Flank the Pikes; then the Pikes may charge on, and the Muskettiers may fall in the Reer of the Pikes, and then Pikes may charge at Foot, and the Muskettiers may give fire altogether over their heads.

The fifth firing. Let the Pikes port, and the Muskettiers move forth to the right and left, and fire by extraduction; then the Pikes may charge again, and the Muskettiers may move forth as before; and the fir≈øt Rank of each divi≈øion may give fire even with the Front and Reer, and ≈øtand; the re≈øt may after move forth cleer of them, and give fire, falling behind their own Divi≈øions of Muskettiers; then face all to their Leader, and clo≈øe their Divi≈øions forward to Order; and then proceed to Figure of Battail.

Command. Half-files, face about; Muskettiers, move forward until you be cleer of the Pikes; the two inmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers, ≈øtand; the two outmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers move forwards, until you be cleer of the inmo≈øt Files; the two outmo≈øt Files of Pikes, face outward, and move three foot cleer of the outmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers; and after to face to Front and Reer, and to move forward until they range even with the Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers; then let them face all to the Front, and ≈øtand ≈øtreight in their Divi≈øions, both Rank-wi≈øe and File-wi≈øe; and they will ≈øtand as in the next Figure.

Upon this Figure let the fir≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after wheel off to the right and left into the room of them in the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving up into their places, firing and falling off in like manner. Then let the inmo≈øt divi≈øions give fire in like manner, as the former did; and wheel off to the right and left, and be relieved by their own Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers; then let the Pikes chaege on, and after retreating back again into their places.

Command. The two middle-ranks of Pikes, face outward, and move cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let the fir≈øt Rank of Pikes face about; and the fir≈øt and la≈øt Rank of Pikes to move forward to Order; face all to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right and left into the room of them in the Reer; they at the ≈øame time moving forward into their places, firing and falling off in like manner: Next let the inmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers do the ≈øame, who may be relieved by the inmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Reer.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them all face to the Reer, and give fire as they did to the Front.

The third firing. Let them face to Front and Reer, and give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves fir≈øt; after falling off, and interchanging divi≈øions, relieving each other; then let the Pikes charge on to Front and Reer, and after retreating back into their places.

Command. The inmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers to move forward until they be two foot cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let them face all inward, and move until the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers range even abre≈øt with the middle-divi≈øions of Pikes; to your Leader.

Upon this former Figure, fire them to both Flanks; where fir≈øt face them outward; let the fir≈øt divi≈øion give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after wheel off to the right and left into the places of the Reer-divi≈øions, and they move up at the ≈øame in≈øtant of time into their rooms, giving fire, and falling in the Reer of them≈øelves; afterward into their places. Next let them fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after move inward, and fall in the Reer of the next divi≈øion of Pikes; and then the fir≈øt divi≈øion of Muskettiers move forth, and give fire in the ground they formerly ≈øtood on, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and ≈øtand; and the next divi≈øion of Muskettiers is likewi≈øe to move forth where formerly they ≈øtood, and to fire and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes may after charge on, and after retreat back again into their places; and face to their Leader.

Command. Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, move to the left two paces, and double to the right File-wi≈øe; the two middle-divi≈øions of Pikes, face outward, and move two paces; to your Leader: Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers move forward, until the fir≈øt divi≈øion of Muskettiers be placed three foot before the mid≈øt of the middle-divi≈øions of Pikes, and the ≈øecond divi≈øion be three foot behind the ≈øame, ≈øtanding ≈øtreight with the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the mid≈øt.

Upon this Figure they being faced to Front and Reer, both Pikes and Muskettiers; let the fir≈øt divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and ≈øtand; let the re≈øt move forward until they be cleer of the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers,
and fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after face about and move down into their places again; then let the Pikes open a little outward, and charge all to Front and Reer; and when they ≈øhall retreat back again into their places, the Muskettiers may fire again as they did before, and continue it as long as they plea≈øe. Or they may fire upon this Figure either to Front or Reer, according to di≈øcretion, as long as they plea≈øe.

Now in re≈øpect much time hath been ≈øpent in the Motions by wheelings in plain firings and Figures of Battail, we will draw forth one Figure more from the former, that the Colours may be di≈øplayed, and that we may conclude our ≈øeventh Exerci≈øe, to refre≈øh the Souldiers for a ≈øpace, until they ≈øhall again have warning from their Commander for another appearance.

Command. The la≈øt Divi≈øion of Muskettiers in the mid≈øt to face about, middle Divi≈øions of Muskettiers advance forward until you be three foot clear of the Front and Reer; to your Leader: each Divi≈øion of Pikes face outward, and move to convenient di≈øtance for the Colours to di≈øplay; to your Leader.

Reducement. Front and Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers face about, Front-divi≈øion move down and double the Reer-divi≈øion to the left rank-wi≈øe; to your Leader: the two fir≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Front face about; then let them, and the two la≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Reer, move forward until they be even with the next Divi≈øions of Muskettiers; to your Leader. The two middle Divi≈øions of Pikes clo≈øe into the mid≈øt to Order, and to open their Ranks from the mid≈øt to ≈øomething more then open Order; the two outmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes face inward, and move forward into the mid≈øt of the two middle Ranks in the Body; to your Leader. Front-divi≈øions of Pikes face about, and Front and Reer-Divi≈øions to move forward and to clo≈øe their Divi≈øions; to your Leader. Files clo≈øe to the right and left inward to Order. Muskettiers in the Front and Reer, double your Pikes by Divi≈øion. Files, double your Depth to the right and left outward, every man falling behind his Bringer-up, they will be reduced as at fir≈øt.

Now the Serjeants may draw off the Muskettiers, filing them to the right and left outward, thereby making a guard for the Captain and other Officers to march through, trooping away and lodging the Colours; which done, one of the Serjeants command the Muskettiers to face about to the right, and to pre≈øent all, and no man to give fire until they hear the beat of Drum; no man pulling his Tricker but once, which will be a means that they all fire hand≈øomly together; which being ended, every man may depart home until he ≈øhall be called forth again.

div.head: CHAP. XXIV. The Eighth Exerci≈øe, con≈øi≈øting of ≈øixty four men, eight Files eight deep.
div.p: THe Souldiers being again brought into the Field, or place of Exerci≈øe, the Serjeants, according to their wonted manner, drawing forth the Files, bids each File-leader to take his File into ≈øome convenient place apart, to exerci≈øe them in their ≈øeveral Po≈øtures and Charges, and after what manner they may fire, whether it be to Front, Reer, or both Flanks. Which being performed, they are called up to joyn into a Body, and commanded to clo≈øe their Ranks and Files to their di≈øtance of Order, and the Front doubled to the right and left inward by the half-files di≈øtance beforehand, being prepared for their moving up. The Leader appoints one of the Serjeants to fetch the Colours, which being brought up to the head of the Company, the Leader for variety ≈øake may ≈øpend the chiefe≈øt of his time in Firings, as followeth.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Muskettiers move forward until their Bringers-up range even with the Front of Pikes; after let the two outmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers move forward until their Bringers-up range even abre≈øt with the Front of the two inmo≈øt Files; Let the Front or foremo≈øt Divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let them face about, and move down into their places where they were la≈øt, then let the two inmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers of each Divi≈øion advance forwards until their Bringers-up range even with the Front of the two outmo≈øt Files, and then let them give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after face about, and march down into their places again where they were la≈øt drawn off.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them give fire on the ground they ≈øtand in each Divi≈øion, falling off to the right and left in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The third firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank in each Divi≈øion fire as they ≈øtand, and after move inward in a ≈øtraight line before the Front of Pikes, which gives way for the next Rank to fire in each Divi≈øion; and after to move inward into the Reer of the fir≈øt Rank, and ≈øo con≈øequently all the re≈øt to fire in like manner until they have all fired, and ≈øtand ≈øtraight before the Pikes.
The fourth firing. Let their Ranks rank outward into the Front, and then give fire all entire in one Rank, and ranking again as they were.
The fifth firing. Let the half-files of Muskettiers double the Front by Divi≈øion, and give fire by two Ranks together, and after to move back again into their places.
The ≈øixth firing. Let the two fir≈øt Ranks kneel down, the other two ≈øtand upright, and give fire four Ranks together.

The ≈øeventh firing. Let the half-files, or Pikes to face about, and move three paces; to your Leader: and then Files to double their Depth to the right and left outward of each Arms; then let them give fire eight Ranks together after this manner, two kneel down, two kneeling, two ≈øtand upright, and the two la≈øt to be drawn off to the right and left; and ≈øo to fire all together; which being ended, command the Pikes by their Files to rank outward into the Front, and then open outward to the right and left, and charge on in the Front, and file again as they were.

The eigth firing. Let the Pikes open their Files from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance; then command the Muskettiers to face about, and move down into the mid≈øt of the Pikes, then let the half-files face about, and let the Muskettiers be at open Order in their Files, and the Pikes at Order; and then let them give fire fir≈øt to Front and Reer by Intraduction after this manner: Let the fir≈øt Rank in Front and Reer pre≈øent and give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and pre≈øently make ready again; the next Ranks may move forward, and place them≈øelves three foot before them, and fire in like manner, and after ≈øtand, the other Ranks ≈øtill moving forward into the next Rank until the fir≈øt have fired, and then immediately to clap before them, and fire in like manner, until all have fired twice over.
The ninth firing. Let them clo≈øe their Files into the mid≈øt to Order, and fire on the ≈øame ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The tenth firing. Let them fire and fall off to the right and left into the mid≈øt of
Pikes again, then let the Pikes charge on to Front and Reer; and when they are clear of the Muskettiers, let them clo≈øe to the right and left inward to Order.

The eleventh firing. Let the Pikes port, and let the Muskettiers be drawn forth one whole Rank to the right, and another to the left, both to Front and Reer give fire, and fall into their places again; then let the other four be drawn forth in like manner, and fire, and fall into their places again; the Pikes, if occa≈øion ≈øhall require, may again charge on.
The twelfth firing. Let the Muskettiers range to the right and left outward, and fire even abre≈øt with the Reer of each Divi≈øion, and move in again into their places.

The thirteenth firing. Let the Muskettiers rank outward, and move even abre≈øt with the Front and Reer, and there pre≈øent and give fire: and while≈øt the Pikes are charging on, they may rank again as they were, and fall in the Reer of the Pikes, and make ready again.

The fourteenth firing. The Pikes being retreated into their fir≈øt ground, you may open them to the right and left, and then the Muskettiers may move forward, and fire two Ranks kneeling down, and the other two ≈øtanding upright; then the Pikes may continue their charge till the Muskettiers make ready again, and after they may retreat, and fall in the Reer of the Muskettiers, and clo≈øe their Divi≈øions inward to Order. The≈øe firings being all upon a ≈øtand, and the Muskettiers being now in Front and Reer, they may be moved away, and may give fire upon the march to Front and Reer after this manner.

The fifteenth firing. Let the fir≈øt Rank in the Front nimbly advance forward ten paces, then pre≈øent and give fire, in which interim, the re≈øt will be moved up unto them; the others having fallen off to the right and left in the Reer of their own Divi≈øions of Muskettiers, the next Rank may give fire in like manner, until all have fired thus once over; the Reer are to fire at the ≈øame time with the Front, facing about the la≈øt Rank, who are to fall off, and to place them≈øelves before their own Divi≈øions of Muskettiers.

The ≈øixteenth firing. Let them fire as before, and the fir≈øt Rank of the Front-divi≈øion to fall off, and flank the Pikes to the right, the re≈øt of that Divi≈øion falling off, and placing them≈øelves in the Reer of them; and likewi≈øe the fir≈øt Rank of the Reer-Divi≈øion, when they have fired, let them fall off, and range even abre≈øt with the half-files of Pikes, and ≈øtill pre≈øerving them≈øelves in their places to be right-hand-men to tho≈øe which were at fir≈øt, and the re≈øt to give fire and fall in the Reer of them.

The ≈øeventeenth firing. Now the Muskettiers being all upon the right Flank, let the outmo≈øt File face to the right and fire, and lead away the Bringers-up between the Muskettiers and the outmo≈øt File of Pikes; let this be continued in the ≈øame manner until all have fired.
The eighteenth firing. The Body ≈øtill marching, let them fire again after the ≈øame manner as before.
The nineteenth firing. Let them fire by Ranks wheeling to the right Flank, and after to rank to the right, ≈øo many abre≈øt as they were at fir≈øt, marching along with the Body.
The twentieth firing. Let them fire, and fall off on the contrary Flank.

The one and twentieth firing. Let them give fire upon the gathering, firing after this manner; let the outmo≈øt File upon the left, face to the left, give fire, and then face to the Front, and ≈øtand until the re≈øt be clear; and then the next File to face to the left and fire, and after face to the Front, and then the fir≈øt File may gather up even abre≈øt upon the left of the ≈øecond File; then the third File may face to the left and give fire; after face to the Front and ≈øtand, until the other two march up on the left, and joyn even abre≈øt with him, and con≈øequently ≈øo all the re≈øt, until every File have fired, and that they be all moved up even abre≈øt with the Pikes.
The two and twentieth firing. Let them wheel Ranks to the left, and fire, and after rank four to the left as they were at fir≈øt, and march even abre≈øt with the Pikes.
The three and twentieth firing. Let them fire to the left Flank, Ranks inverting, and after face to the Front, and to rank again as they were.

The four and twentieth firing. Let them fire by Files, filing to the right, and facing after to the left, and fire to the left Flank; and then facing to their fir≈øt Front, and to lead up their Files to the left again as they were.
The five and twentieth firing. Let them fire by the outmo≈øt Files to the left Flank, and lead away by the Leader, up between, or in the middle of Pikes.

The ≈øix and twentieth firing. Let them face outward, and fire upon a ≈øtand after this manner by Ranks dividing, moving forth to the right and left, and fire and fall in again into their places, the Pikes may after charge on, and retreat again into their places.

The ≈øeven and twentieth firing. Let them fire by Ranks, ranking outward into both the Flanks, and moving forward, and firing even abre≈øt, and ranking again as they were, but not returning again into the mid≈øt of Pikes from whence they were drawn forth, but fire to both Flanks, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.
The eight and twentieth firing. Let them fire again, and fall in the Reer or mid≈øt of Pikes.
The nine and twentieth firing. Let the Pikes port, and let the Muskettiers fire by Extraduction to both Flanks, and return again into their places.

The thirtieth firing. Let the Pikes open to the right, and the Muskettiers move up into the mid≈øt, and the fir≈øt Rank give fire, and ≈ølieve up to the right and left, and place them≈øelves before the Pikes, the next Rank moving forward into his ground, and ≈ølieving away in the Reer of them until all have fired.
The one and thirtieth firing. Let them clo≈øe their Divi≈øions, and fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.
The two and thirtieth firing. Let them fire by Files ranking outward, and filing again as they were.

The three and thirtieth firing. Let them fire by Ranks wheeling outward into both Flanks towards Front and Reer; the half-files are to face about, the left half-ranks are to wheel to the right, the right half-ranks to the left, the Front-half-files doing the like, may give fire, facing after to the right and left inward, ranking as they were into the mid≈øt of Ranks, and facing again to the Flanks.
The four and thirtieth firing. Let them fire two Ranks together, and ≈ølieving pre≈øently away, and flank the Pikes.
The five and thirtieth firing. Let them face to Front and Reer, and after move outward, and facing to the outward Angles of Front and Reer, and let them fire and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The ≈øix and thirtieth firing. Let them clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order, and fire again, and let them fall off to the right and left, and flank the Pikes, then face all to their fir≈øt Front, they are reduced.
Having ≈øpent all this time in the plain Firings, we will in the next place proceed to Firings upon ≈øuch Figures of Battail as followeth.

div.head: CHAP. XXV. Several Figures of Battail.
div.p: Command. HAlf-files double your Front to the left, Muskettiers double your Pikes entire, advancing; Files open from the mid≈øt to double di≈øtance: the two outmo≈øt Files clo≈øe outward to open Order, and the two inmo≈øt Files clo≈øe outward to the ≈øame di≈øtance; half-files of each Divi≈øion double the Front inward entire; Ranks and Files clo≈øe to Order; the four outmo≈øt Files upon each Flank ≈øtand; the four inmo≈øt Files upon the left face to the Reer; then let the four inmo≈øt Files upon the left, and the four inmo≈øt Files upon the right, move forward three foot before the Front and Reer, and then face to the left, and move two paces, then face all to the Front, and move ≈øtraight in their Divi≈øions, both Rank-wi≈øe and File-wi≈øe, they will ≈øtand as followeth.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers move forward, until they be cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and then clo≈øing their Files into the mid≈øt to Order before the Front of Pikes, the Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers may move forward unto the Front of the fir≈øt divi≈øion of Pikes, and there rank outward, and give fire altogether, and file again as they were, and after face about, and move down again into their places; the two outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers may next move forward ≈øome ≈øix paces; there ≈øtand and rank inward, and fire; face about, and file again as they were, and move forward to the Front of their own divi≈øions of Pikes; & face to their Leader.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers fire, and fall off to the right and left, and flank their Pikes; and at the ≈øame time let the Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers move forward as they did before, and fire even abre≈øt with the fir≈øt divi≈øions of Pikes, & fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then face about, and move down into their places, and face to their Leader; then let the two outmo≈øt divi≈øions upon the Flanks give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall off to the right and left, and flank the Pikes: they may fire to the Reer in the ≈øame manner, being thither faced.

The third firing. Let them face to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and fire the fir≈øt Rank of each divi≈øion, and fall off to the right and left in the Reer of the Pikes; and the la≈øt Rank at the ≈øame time move forth, and give fire, and fall into their places again: but before they thus fire, the Front and Reer-divi≈øions are to be wheeled to the left, and then let them fire byMove forth tho≈øe Muskettiers into their former places, before they fire by Extraduction. Extraduction; and the Pikes may after charge on, and then retreat back again into their places.
Command. Each divi≈øion as they are faced to move forward three paces; Half-files of each divi≈øion, open to the right until they be cleer of the ≈øtanding part, they will ≈øtand as followeth.

Upon the former Figure being faced to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, fire then according unto all tho≈øe places, the formo≈øt Divi≈øions fire fir≈øt, and let them wheel off to the right and left, and fall in the room or place of them in the next Divi≈øions, firing twice in this kind. Then let the formo≈øt Divi≈øions fire and fall in the Reer of the Pikes; then let the Pikes port, and the Muskettiers in each Divi≈øion may move forth again, and give fire by Extraduction; then let the Pikes charge on, and after charge at foot, and let the Muskettiers give fire over their heads, which being ended, let the formo≈øt Rank of Muskettiers in Front, Reer and Flanks move forward, and interchange ground with the Pikes, and face all to the Front; and after the third Divi≈øions from the Front, and the third Divi≈øions from the Reer, face inward, and move three paces; then face to their Leader, and clo≈øe Files outward, and Ranks forward to Order in each Divi≈øion, and ≈øtand ≈øtraight and even in their Divi≈øions, both Rank-wi≈øe and File-wi≈øe, and then proceed to the next Figure.

Command. The outmo≈øt Divi≈øions upon the Flanks, face about, and move down two paces; to your Leader. Half-files of the two outmo≈øt Divi≈øions double to the right and left inward Rank-wi≈øe, and after move that part that doubled two paces to the right and left inward; face all to your Leader.

Upon this Figure let the fir≈øt and the la≈øt Rank of Muskettiers double to the right and left inward File-wi≈øe; then let the fir≈øt Divi≈øion give fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, then wheel off to the right about down into the Reer, and let every Divi≈øion that are in the mid≈øt move up ≈øucce≈ø≈øively into the Front until all have fired and fallen off in like manner as the fir≈øt, and every Divi≈øion become again into his place, and the Front and Reer-Divi≈øions have doubled Ranks to the right and left outward; then command the fir≈øt and the la≈øt Rank of Muskettiers from the Front and Reer to double to the right and left outward File-wi≈øe, and let them give fire and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after fall off into the Reer in like manner and form of the firing of the former Divi≈øions; either of the≈øe firings may be continued twice over: after command the fir≈øt Divi≈øion of Muskettiers from Front and Reer to double to the right and left inward Rank-wi≈øe, and then proceed.

Command. The third Divi≈øion from the Front, and the third Divi≈øion from the Reer to face outward, and to move three paces until they ≈øtand ≈øtraight in Front and Reer between the middle Divi≈øions, and after face to their Leader. Then let the Front-Divi≈øions face about, and Front and Reer-Divi≈øions move forward until they range even abre≈øt with the ≈øecond Divi≈øions that ≈øtands before them, and then face to their Leader: it occa≈øioneth the next Figure.

Upon this Figure you may fire them to Front, Reer, and both Flanks; therefore face the two outmo≈øt cro≈ø≈øes to the Flanks, which contains on each ≈øide four divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers; and let the re≈øt face to Front and Reer, and let all the Muskettiers in the Reer of each divi≈øion of Pikes, move forth to the Angles of the Pikes, give fire, and fall back again into their places; and whil≈øt the Pikes are charging on, the Muskettiers may make ready again, and fire in like manner as before, and fall back again into their places; the Pikes charging on to Front, Reer and both Flanks as before; and retreating again into their places. Then face them all to the Front, and let the ≈øecond divi≈øion from the Reer face about; and then the ≈øecond divi≈øion from the Front, and the ≈øecond divi≈øion from the Reer, move forward until they be three foot cleer of the Front and Reer; then face them to their Leader, and they will ≈øtand in a convenient Figure for marching, wherein the Colours may di≈øplay ≈øo long as a Commander ≈øhall think fit.

Reducement. The two middle-divi≈øions, face to the right and left outward, and march cleer of the ≈øtanding part; to your Leader; then let them double to the right and left outward file-wi≈øe. After let them face to Front, Reer and both Flanks, and clo≈øe their Files into the mid≈øt to Order. Then command Front and Reer-divi≈øions that formerly wheeled to the left, to wheel back again to the right; then face all to the Front, and let the Front-divi≈øion. face to the right, and move three paces; and then face to their Leader then let the Reer-divi≈øion move up upon the left of them in the Front, and let the Pikes in each divi≈øion double their depth to the right and left outward; and let them clo≈øe files into the mid≈øt to order, & ranks forward to order, & to move up even with el≈øe front, they ≈øtanding in their di≈øtance of order, both in rank and file, let the half-files
double their Front inward intire, and after Files to double their depth intire to the right, they are reduced.

Then the Leader may appoint one of the Serjeants to draw off the Muskettiers, and file them away to the right and left outward, either by Ranks filing, or Files filing, and every Muskettier to poy≈øe his Musket; then the Pikes may advance their Arms, and the Drums beat a Troop, and the Commander may lead them away and lodge his Colours.

div.head: CHAP. XXVI. The ninth Exerci≈øe, con≈øi≈øting of 64 men, eight Files eight deep.
div.p: IN this Exerci≈øe a Commander may in matter of Motions pre≈øent unto the Souldiers farther variety to delight them withal, in bringing each man into the Front to be a File-leader, according unto ≈øucce≈ø≈øion and dignity, by proper words of Command, by doublings, with their Reducement. Therefore, to avoid any further circum≈øtance, we will pa≈øs over the Po≈øtures, and fetching of the Colours; and ≈øuppo≈øe the Souldiers ≈øtanding in a condition to be exerci≈øed, begin fir≈øt to make them all File-leaders by ≈øucce≈ø≈øion as followeth.
Command. Ranks to the left double.
Command. Files to the left double.
Command. Half-files, double your Front to the right.
Command. Double your Files to the right intire advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Ranks to the right double.
Command. Files to the right double.
Command. Front-half-files, double the Reer to the right.
Command. Double your Files to the left intire, advancing.
Command. Double your Ranks to the right into the Reer; face all about.
Command. Double your Files to the left, advancing.
Direction. Every even File from the left move forward to the left, and by three ≈øteps double the odd, advancing.
Command. Half-files, double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the left intire, advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Double your Ranks to the left into the Reer; face all about.
Command. Double your Files to the right, advancing.
Reducement. Files, rank to the right into the Front.
Ranks, file eight to the right, reduceth them.
Next followeth to make every man File-leader according unto dignity, with their Reducement.
Command. Bringers-up, double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the right intire, advancing.
Command. Half-files, double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the left intire, advancing, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader.
Command. Bringers-up, double your Front to the right.
Command. Files, double your depth to the right.
Command. Ranks to the right double.
Command. Front-half-files, double your Reer to the right, following your Leaders.
Command. Double your Files to the right by divi≈øion, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader and his Bringer-up.
Command. Front-half-files, double your Reer to the left, following your Leaders.
Command. Double your Files to the left by divi≈øion, every man placing him≈øelf before his Leader and his Bringer-up.
Command. The two fir≈øt and the two la≈øt Ranks double the four middlemo≈øt Ranks to the right, following your Leaders and your Bringers-up.

Direction. The four middle-ranks ≈øtand; the File-leaders are to turn off to the
right, and the next Rank is to follow them until the Leaders Rank even with the Bringers-up of the Front-half-files; and at the ≈øame in≈øtant of time the Bringers-up are to move forward to the right; the re≈øt following until the Bringers-up range even abre≈øt with the Half-file-leaders; to your Leader.
Command. Files, double your depth to the left.
Reducement. Half-files, double your Front to the right.
Bringers-up, double your Front to the right.
Then divide every four Files di≈øtinctly apart, making five divi≈øions.
Files, double to the right and left inward in each divi≈øion, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order.
Files, double to the left intire, advancing; reduceth.

div.head: CHAP. XXVIII. Eight ≈øeveral Counter-marches, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. FIles to the right-hand, Counter-march, maintaining ground.
Command. Ranks to the left-hand, Counter-march, lo≈øing ground.
Command. Counter-march your Front and Reer-half-files into the mid≈øt of Ranks.
Direction. Half-files, face about, and turn off to the left; and Front-half-files, turn off to the right until they meet the Front and Reer into the mid≈øt; to your Leader.
Command. Right and Left-half-ranks, Counter-march into the mid≈øt of Files.
Direction. Face outward; Right-half-ranks, turn off to the right; Left-half-ranks, turn off to the left; to your Leader.
Command. Files to the left-hand, Counter-march, lo≈øing ground by following your Leaders.
Command. Ranks to the right-hand, Counter-march, maintaining ground.
Command. Counter-march your Front and Reer-half-files to the right and left, following the Half-file-leaders, and the Bringers-up of the Front-half-files.

Direction. Half-files, face about; the Bringers-up of the Front-half-files and the Half-file-leaders are to begin the motion; the re≈øt are to follow until they have gained ≈øo much ground beyond the Front and Reer, as they formerly po≈ø≈øe≈øt in the mid≈øt; to your Leader, and clo≈øe your divi≈øions.
Command. Counter-march your Half-ranks to the right and left, by following of the inmo≈øt files.

Direction. Face outward; the inmo≈øt Files are to begin the motion moving forward, the re≈øt following, until they have gained ≈øo much ground beyond the Flanks as they formerly po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed in the inmo≈øt Files; to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXIX. Ten ≈øeveral Wheelings, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. WHeel the Battail off by Divi≈øion from the Front.
Command. Wheel the body off by Divi≈øion from the right Flank; face to the right.
Command. VVheel the Battail off by Divi≈øion from the Reer; face about.
Command. VVheel the body off by divi≈øion from the left Flank.
Command. VVheel your Battail inward to the Reer from the Front.Clo≈øe Ranks forward to clo≈øe Orderr, and Files into the midst to clo≈øe Order.
Direction. Open outward to convenient di≈øtance; to your Leader.
Command. VVheel your battail inward to the left Flank from the right.
Direction. Face to the right, and open to convenient di≈øtance, to your Leader.
Command. VVheel your battail inward to the Front from the Reer.
Direction. Face about, and open to convenient di≈øtance, and wheel inward into the Front.
Command. VVheel your battail inward to the right Flank from the left.
Command. VVheel the outward Angles of Front and Reer to the right and left about into the Center; face to the outward Angles.
Command. VVheel the inward Angles to the right and left about from the Center.

div.head: CHAP. XXX. Plain Firings, and Figures of Battail.
div.p: IN the next place I will proceed to ≈øome plain firings; wherefore, fir≈øt, double your Ranks forward to the left by Half-files, and fire even with the Front of Pikes, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then fire, and fall between the Pikes; then move forth after this manner; one Rank drawn forth to the right, and another to the left, fire, and fall in again as before. Then command the fir≈øt Rank to ≈øtand, and the re≈øt to move forth, both Pikes and Muskettiers to the right and left, until each Rank be cleer of other; then let the Pikes charge, and Muskettiers give fire altogether, and after fall behind each Rank of Pikes; then let the Pikes charge at Foot, and let the Muskettiers give fire over their heads: after let Pikes port, and let the Muskettiers come forth again, and give fire by extraduction; and after command the Ranks to face to the right and left inward, and to clo≈øe their Divi≈øions: then let the Muskettiers move forth again into their fir≈øt places, and Flank their Pikes. And having pa≈ø≈øed over ≈øome half a dozen firings after this manner, then command Half-files to double their depth to the right intire, and proceed to Figures of battail, and firings which comes in the next place to view for a Leader, to ≈øpend his time further in the exerci≈øing of his Souldiers therein.

Command. Half-files, face to the Reer, and march ≈øix paces; to your Leader; Half-files of Muskettiers of each Divi≈øion, face to the Reer. Muskettiers, march all until you be cleer of the Pikes; to your Leader. The two middlemo≈øt Ranks of Pikes of each divi≈øion, face outward, and move cleer of the Muskettiers; to your Leader: The fir≈øt and third Ranks of Pikes in the body, face to the Reer, and clo≈øe Ranks into the mid≈øt to Order, the following Figure will appear.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, the re≈øt of the Divi≈øions moving up into their ground, and fire, wheeling off to the right and left, having all fired over once, they will be reduced.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the four inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers face outward, and move cleer of the Pikes; then face to their Leader; then let the eight la≈øt divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers face to the Reer; then let them fire to Front and Reer, falling in the Reer of them≈øelves; there being intervals for the Pikes to move forward upon their charge, and being retreated back into their places, will produce the following Figure.

After the Figure is reduced unto his fir≈øt a≈øpect, command the Muskettiers, or Divi≈øions upon the wings, to face to the right and left inward, and to march until they ≈øtand as in the fir≈øt Figure; then face to their Leader: and command the eight fir≈øt Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers to face outward, marching until you perceive an interval for the eight Reer-divi≈øions to move up, and make an even range with the Front-divi≈øions; which being done, they will appear as followeth.

Upon this Figure let the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right into the room of them in the Reer, they at the ≈øame time firing, and wheeling off into their places again.

Then let the Commander face them all to the right, and they will ≈øtand in four cro≈ø≈øes, with Muskettiers on the wings File-wi≈øe; upon which facing they may march, the Officers being placed according unto di≈øcretion; and after they have marched, let them face again to their fir≈øt Front.

Command. Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face to the right, and move two paces; to your Leader. Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, move up, and double the Front-Divi≈øions to the left Rank-wi≈øe, which produceth the next Figure.

Upon the former Figure let all the Muskettiers give fire together, and fall off to the right and left in the Reer of them≈øelves, the Pikes after charging through the intervals, and after retreating again. Then command Muskettiers that doubled to face about, and to move down into the Reer, until they be clear of the Pikes, and ≈øtand; then let the Muskettiers both in Front and Reer face to the left, and march until they ≈øtand ≈øtraight in their Divi≈øions; then face to their Leader, and they will ≈øtand as in the former Figure: then proceed.

Command. The four inmo≈øt Divi≈øions both of Pikes and Muskettiers on the left, face to the Reer; inmo≈øt Divi≈øions both of Pikes and Muskettiers both upon the right and left, march clear of the ≈øtanding part; then let them face to the left, and move three paces; to your Leader. The four outmo≈øt Divi≈øions both of Pikes and Muskettiers upon the right, wheel to the right; the four outmo≈øt Divi≈øions upon the left both of Pikes and Muskettiers, wheel to the left, which will ≈øet forth the next Figure.

Tht fir≈øt firing. Let them face to the Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after wheeling off to the right your Divi≈øions on the out≈øide of the Pikes into the place of the Reer-Divi≈øions, which are to advance forward into the Front, performing the like as the other Front-Divi≈øions.

The ≈øecond firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers move to the right two paces; after command Divi≈øions of Muskettiers to double to the left Rank-wi≈øe, and let them give fire in Front, Reer, and both Flanks all together: the Pikes may after charge to all the≈øe places, while≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again, and retreat again into their places.
The third firing. Let them give fire again, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; which being ended, you may proceed to another Figure.
Command. The left Divi≈øion of Muskettiers, wheele off to the left, and place your ≈øelves in the left interval between the Pikes, which occa≈øioneth the next Figure.

Upon this Figure let the Muskettiers give fire in the Front, Reer, and Flanks, and Angles, falling in the Reer of them≈øelves, and the Pikes may after charge on. Many other firings might be performed upon this Figure, but I ≈øhall not be tedious to relate any more, but leave them to the di≈øcretion of every Leaders genius, and ≈øhall now ≈øhew the way to reduce them.

Reducement. Divi≈øions of Muskettiers upon the Angles, face to the Center, and move three paces; after wheel the Divi≈øions a little to the right, until they be brought in the Reer of their own Divi≈øions of Muskettiers; which being done, command the four Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers on the right to wheel to the left; and the four Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers upon the left to wheel to the right. After command the four Divi≈øions of Pikes and Muskettiers upon the left, to face to the left, and march to ≈øuch a convenient di≈øtance, as that the four la≈øt Divi≈øions, both Pikes and Muskettiers, may move up on the left to range even with the Front, they on the Flanks moving up al≈øo until they ≈øtand all even abre≈øt. After command the inmo≈øt eight Divi≈øions to face to the Reer, and let them all move until they be clear one of another, then face to their Leader; and let the eight Front-divi≈øions face inward, and to move until they ≈øtand ≈øtraight with the Reer-divi≈øions. After let the Pikes in the Body in each Divi≈øion open their Ranks to Front and Reer to their open Order. And then command Divi≈øions of Pikes upon the Flanks to face to the right and left inward, and march in and ≈øtrengthen the Body of Pikes; which being done, let the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers face to the Reer, commanding them all to clo≈øe their Ranks forward to Order, and
face to their Leader, they are reduced. Which being performed, the Leader may lodge his Colours, having fini≈øhed his ninth Exerci≈øe.

div.head: CHAP. XXXI. The tenth Exerci≈øe, con≈øi≈øting of 24 Files being ≈øix deep, according to the fir≈øt drawing up of a private Company.
div.p: THere being a greater number appearing upon this days Exerci≈øe then in the former, it concerns a Leader more e≈øpecially to give ≈øpecial charge to the inferiour Officers to be careful in the drawing forth the Files, that they make no man a File-Leader, Bringer-up, Half-file-Leader, or Bringer-up of the Front-half-files, but ≈øuch able Souldiers as may be de≈øerving of the ≈øame; who≈øe diligence and care upon all motions is principally required, being, as it were, the hinges of the Leaders ≈øeveral words of Command. Wherefore ≈øuppo≈øing them to be drawn up in Battalia, and the Colours being brought to the head of the Company, the four Serjeants ready at hand attending their Captains commands, and the body being clo≈øed in Ranks and Files to their di≈øtance of Order, and ≈øilence craved at the Company, he that ≈øhall exerci≈øe them may begin, after Di≈øtances and Facings ≈øhewen, with this or the like doubling following.

div.head: CHAP. XXXII. Eight entire ≈øeveral Doublings, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. FRont half-files double your Reer inward entire.
Command. The twelve inmo≈øt Files double entire the depth of the ≈øix outmo≈øt Files. Inmo≈øt Files face about.
Command. Half-files double your Front to the right.
Command. Double your Files to the right entire, advancing.
Command. Half-files double your Front inward entire.
Command. The ≈øix outmo≈øt Files upon each Flank double entire, advancing the twelve middle Files.
Command. Half-files double your Front to the right entire.
Command. Right half-ranks double your left Flank entire, advancing; which being performed, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXXIII. Eight ≈øeveral Countermarches, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. FIle-Leaders ≈øtand, the re≈øt pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves before your Leaders.
Command. The right-hand-file ≈øtand, the re≈øt pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves on the out≈øide of your right-hand-men.
Command. Countermarch your Front and Reer into the mid≈øt of Ranks.
Direction. Half-files face about and turn off to the left, Front-half-files turn off to the right; to your Leader.
Command. Countermarch your Flanks into the mid≈øt of Files; face outward.
Command. Files to the right hand Countermarch, maintaining ground.
Command. Ranks, to the left hand Countermarch, lo≈øing ground.
Command. Countermarch your Front and Reer half-files from the mid≈øt of Ranks, maintaining ground.
Direction. Front-half-files face about, and turn off to the left, the re≈øt turn off to the right, every man moving up into his Leaders ground; to your Leader.
Command. Countermarch your right and left half-ranks from the mid≈øt of Files, lo≈øing ground.
Direction. Face inward, and turn off every Rank on the ground they ≈øtand; face to your Leader, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to open Order, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXXIV. Eight entire Doublings by Wheelings, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. WHeel off your Reer-half-files, and double your Front to the right entire. Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel off your left half-ranks, and double your right Flank entire to the left. Face outward.
Command. Wheel off your Reer half-files, and double your Front to the left entire. Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel off your right half-ranks, and double your left Flank to the left entire. Face outward.
Command. Wheel off your Front-half-files, and double the Reer to the right entire. Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel off your right half-ranks, and double the left Flank to the right entire. Face outward.
Command. Wheel off your Front-half-files, and double the Reer to the left entire. Half-files face about.
Command. Wheel off your left half-ranks, and double your right Flank to the right entire. Face outward.

div.head: CHAP. XXXV. Plain Firings, and Figures of Battail.
div.p: The fir≈øt firing. LEt the two outmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers upon each Flank advance ten paces before the Front give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, after face about, and move down into their places again; then face to their Leader. Then let the next two Files upon each Flank move away in like manner, and fire as the former did, and move down into their places again. After let the other remaining Files be led forth by the other two Serjeants, and give fire as before, and fall back again into their places.

The ≈øecond firing. Let two Serjeants draw four Files upon each Flank, and move them away 10 or 20 paces before the Front, and give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after face about, and move down into their places. And while≈øt they are moving down, let the other two Serjeants draw forth the remaining four Files upon each Flank, and fire as the former did, and after return again into their places.

The third firing. Let all the Muskettiers move forth cleer of the Pikes, and let them open from the mid≈øt, until they ≈øtand in four Divi≈øions, leaving ≈øufficient intervals for their wheeling into the Reer of them≈øelves; fir≈øt, let them fire in each Divi≈øion, falling in the Reer of them≈øelves, until they have all fired over two or three times after this kind.

The fourth firing. Let them clo≈øe their Files before the Front of Pikes into the mid≈øt to Order, then let the two fir≈øt Ranks kneel down, the next two ≈øtoop, and the la≈øt two ≈øtand upright, and give fire ≈øix Ranks all together; then let the left half-ranks of Muskettiers be wheeled about to the left into the Reer of the Pikes, and the right half-ranks move to the left until they ≈øtand ≈øtraight before the Front of Pikes.

The fifth firing. Let the half-files face about, and let them give fire to Front and Reer after this manner by two Ranks drawn off ten paces before the Front and Reer, and fall off to the right and left into the Reer of them≈øelves: then facing about, let them open outward, and give way for the next two Ranks to come forward into their places, who are to fire and fall off as the former did, the other two Ranks doing the ≈øame. This firing may be continued as long as the Leader plea≈øeth.
The ≈øixth firing. Let them give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall off to the right and left into the Reer of them≈øelves.
The ≈øeventh firing. Let them rank outward into Front and Reer, and give fire all together, and rank again as they were.

The eighth firing. Let them give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and flank the Pikes, tho≈øe in the Front flanking the Pikes on the right, they in the Reer flanking them on the left; after let the Pikes charge on, and being retreated into their places, let them face all to their Leader, and in the next place proceed to Figures of Battail.

Command. Files, open outward to open Order; Ranks, open backward to your open Order; then let every four Files clo≈øe outward to Order; and Ranks clo≈øe to Front and Reer to Order, they will ≈øtand in twelve Divi≈øions as followeth.

Command. The two inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Reer, face about; inmo≈øt Divi≈øions of Muskettiers in Front and Reer, move forward clear of the ≈øtanding part, and ≈øtand; Pikes face outward, Muskettiers upon the Flanks face inward, the re≈øt face about to the right, move all two paces; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers give fire, and fall in the reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right & left into the room of them in the reer, they at the ≈øame time moving up into their ground, firing, & falling off in like manner as before. Then let the Front-divi≈øions upon the Flank fire, & fall in the reer of them≈øelves, and after wheel off to the right and left into the ground of tho≈øe divi≈øions that ≈øtand in the reer of them, they at the ≈øame time relieving them, firing and falling off as before; then let the Pikes charge on, and after retreat into their places.

The ≈øecond firing. Let them face to Front and Reer, and let the fir≈øt Divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheeling off to the right and left, and interchange ground with the next Divi≈øions, who are at the ≈øame in≈øtant of time to move up into their places, and to give fire in like manner, and to fall off and return where they were before; then let the Pikes charge on to Front and Reer, and after retreat into their places, and face all to their Leader.

Command. The four la≈øt Divi≈øions next to the Reer both of Pikes and Muskettiers, face about, move down, and range even abre≈øt with the Reer; Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers that are faced to the Front, move forward, and place your ≈øelves three foot ≈øhort of the next Divi≈øions that ≈øtands before you; to your Leader.

Upon this Figure let the Front-divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right and left, and range even abre≈øt with the next divi≈øions; yet keeping them≈øelves di≈øtinctly from the other divi≈øions. Then let tho≈øe divi≈øions of Muskettiers that ≈øtood in the Reer of them, move forward into their ground, and give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; after face about, and move down again into their fir≈øt places; then let tho≈øe that fir≈øt fired move up again into their ground, and let the outmo≈øt divi≈øions begin to fire after this manner; let the fir≈øt divi≈øions fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and after fall off to the right and left, and place them≈øelves in the room of the Reer-divi≈øions, who are likewi≈øe to move up into their ground, and there to fire, and fall off as before; the Pikes may after charge on, and retreat back again into their places. The ≈øame firings may be performed to the Reer, they being thither faced: but to let that pa≈øs, we will fall upon the next Figure, wherefore,

Command. Divi≈øions of Pikes, move forward until your Reer-divi≈øions range even abre≈øt with the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers; Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers face inward, and move ≈øtreight in the Reer of the Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes; to your Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the two la≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers face about, and the other divi≈øions of Muskettiers to face to the right and left outward, and let them give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; the Pikes may charge on, whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them face all to the Reer, and let the Reer-divi≈øions move forth to the right and left outward, and give fire altogether, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The third firing. Let the four fir≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, and the two fir≈øt di≈øions of Pikes face to the Front, and let them give fire to Front and Reer, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then face all to the Front, and proceed farther.

Command. The Front and Reer-divi≈øions to move outward two paces: Reer-divi≈øion of Pikes upon the left, face about; Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes, move three foot before the Front and Reer; to your Leader; divi≈øions that moved outward, clo≈øe inward to your fir≈øt ground, then they will ≈øtand as followeth.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the fir≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers give fire to the Front, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then face outward, and march cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then face to their Leader: then let every divi≈øion of Muskettiers come ≈øucce≈ø≈øively into that ground, fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then face about, and move down into their places; then let the Front-divi≈øions of Pikes charge on, and after retreat back into their places.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them face all to the Reer, and let every divi≈øion give fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The third firing. Let half the Muskettiers, and three divi≈øions of Pikes, face about to the right, and give fire to Front and Reer on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let the Pikes charge on, and after retreat back into their places; face all to their Leader.

Command. The outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face outward, and move two paces; to your Leader; the other divi≈øions, both Pikes and Muskettiers, open your Files outward to open Order: the five fir≈øt divi≈øions, face about; the five fir≈øt, and the five la≈øt divi≈øions, move ≈øtreight forward, and interchange ground; and after face to their Leader, and clo≈øe Files inward again to Order; then lead up the two outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers to ≈øtand even abre≈øt again≈øt the middle-divi≈øions of Pikes; face all to your Leader: then move the two outmo≈øt divi≈øions to the right and left inward, to ≈øtand ≈øtreight in the middle of the Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers.

Upon this Figure ≈øeveral firings might be performed, to Front, Reer, both Flanks, and four Angles, all at one and the ≈øame time; but being ≈øo ea≈øie to the view, I ≈øhall leave them unto the di≈øcretion of tho≈øe which ≈øhall be plea≈øed to make u≈øe of them, and in the next place endeavour to reduce them.

Reducement. Middle-divi≈øions of Muskettiers upon the Flanks, face outward, and move cleer of the ≈øtanding part; to your Leader: the five fir≈øt Divi≈øions, face about; the five fir≈øt and the five la≈øt Divi≈øions, open Files outward to open Order, and move forward, and interchange ground, and clo≈øe Files inward again to Order; outmo≈øt Divi≈øions, face about, and move down again into your fir≈øt places; face all to your Leader. Here the Captain, if he plea≈øe, may command the En≈øign to di≈øplay his Colours; which being ended, he may proceed, commanding Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes to move forward, and to place them≈øelves in the Reer of the outmo≈øt divi≈øion of Pikes upon the left in the Front; then let the Front-divi≈øion of Pikes move down, and place them≈øelves in the Reer of the ≈øecond divi≈øion of Pikes upon the right; then clo≈øe Pikes into the mid≈øt to Order. Inmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers move forward to Order, and march up even with the Front; Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers, face outward, and move until they ≈øtand ≈øtreight with the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers; then face to their Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks forward to Order, and march up and make an even Front, and clo≈øe Files into the mid≈øt to Order; they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXXVI. The eleventh Exerci≈øe, with 24 Files ≈øix deep.
div.p: THe Souldiers being met at the place appointed, and the Officers being vigilant and careful in their ≈øeveral places, in drawing forth the Files, and joyning them into a Body; the Leader without any farther delay may crave their ≈øilence, and clo≈øe their Ranks and Files to Order; and after ≈øome di≈øtances and facings ≈øhewn unto them, drawn forth from the former Rule, he may proceed to this following doubling, making every man a File-leader according to ≈øucce≈ø≈øion, and after reduce them again.
Command. Ranks to the left, double.
Command. Files to the left, double.
Command. Half-files, double your Front to the left.
Command. Files, double your depth to the left.
Command. Bringers-up, double your Front to the right.
Command. Double your Files to the left intire, advancing.
Command. Bringers-up, double your Front to the left.
Command. Double your Files to the right intire, advancing.
Command. Ranks to the right, double.
Command. Files to the right, double.
Reducement. Files, rank to the left into the Front.
Rank, file ≈øix to the left, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXXVII. Eight Counter-marches, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. BRingers-up, ≈øtand to the re≈øt, pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves behind your Bringers-up. The re≈øt face about.
Command. File-leaders and Bringers-up, ≈øtand; the re≈øt pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves before your Leaders and Bringers-up; Half-files, face about.
Command. Ranks to the left-hand, counter-march, maintaining ground; face to the left.
Command. Right and Left-half-ranks, Counter-march from the mid≈øt of Files, maintaining ground; face inward.
Command. File-leaders, face about to the re≈øt; pa≈øs through to the right, and place your ≈øelves behind your Leader; to your Leader.
Command. Counter-march your Front and Reer-half-files from the mid≈øt of ranks, lo≈øing ground; Front-half-files, face about.
Command. Ranks to the right hand, Countermarch, lo≈øing ground.
Command. Counter-march your right and left-half-ranks, every man placing him≈øelf on the out≈øide of his right and left-hand-man, they are reduced.

div.head: CHAP. XXXVIII. Eight ≈øeveral Wheelings, with their Reducement.
div.p: Command. WHeel your right and Left-half-ranks inward to the mid≈øt of Files. Face outward.
Command. Wheel the battail off by divi≈øion from the Reer.
Command. Wheel the battail inward to the right Flank from the left. Face to the left.
Command. Wheel Front and Reer-half-files inward to the mid≈øt of Ranks. Half-files, face about.
Command. Wheel off your right and Left-half-ranks by divi≈øion from the mid≈øt of Files. Face inward.
Command. Wheel off your Front and Reer-half-files by divi≈øion from the mid≈øt of Ranks; Front-half-files, face about.
Command. Wheel off your Front by divi≈øion.
Command. Wheel your battail inward to the left Flank from the right; face to the right.

div.head: CHAP. XXXIX. Plain Firings, and Figures of Battail.
div.p: The fir≈øt firing. LEt them give fire to the Front by Introduction; where, fir≈øt, command to open their Files outward to open Order, and then let the fir≈øt Rank give fire on the ground they ≈øtand; then let the next Rank move forward, and place them≈øelves before the fir≈øt Rank, and give fire likewi≈øe, and ≈øtand; and ≈øo ≈øucce≈ø≈øively every Rank is to move forward, and place them≈øelves before the Rank that fired, until all have given fire: this being twice performed reduceth them, and is tearm'd a firing of gaining ground.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them fire by Files inward to Order, and fire on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall off to the right and left into the Reer of them≈øelves.
The third firing. Let them clo≈øe their Files, ranking outward into one intire Rank into the Front, all at one and the ≈øame time, and to File again as they were.

The fourth firing. Let the Muskettiers double Ranks to the right and left outward, and give fire three Ranks together; the fir≈øt kneeling, the ≈øecond ≈øtooping, the third ≈øtanding upright, and after to double Files to the right and left inward.
The fifth firing. Let them fire again, and fall off to the right and left, and flank the Pikes, who may after charge on, and after retreat back again into their places.
The ≈øixth firing. Let them face outward, and give fire to both Flanks on the ground they ≈øtand, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves.

The ≈øeventh firing. Let the Half-files of Muskettiers face outward, and move cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let every divi≈øion give fire again, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and then clo≈øe their divi≈øions.
The eighth firing. Let them give fire eight Ranks together (viz) two kneel down, two ≈øtooping, two ≈øtanding upright, and the la≈øt two to be drawn forth, and ≈øo fire them altogether.

The ninth firing. Let the four fir≈øt Ranks upon each Flank fire again, and fall off to the right and left, and flank the Pikes, and let tho≈øe Muskettiers face to Front and Reer, and draw forth the la≈øt Rank of Muskettiers upon the Flanks to the right and left outward, and place them in the mid≈øt of tho≈øe intervals upon the Angles; the Pikes being impaled, then Fire them to Front, Reer, and both Flanks, and four Angles, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves. This firing may be continued as long as a Leader ≈øhall think fit; then face about tho≈øe Files ≈øtanding at the Angles, and move them in the Reer of tho≈øe divi≈øions of Muskettiers upon the Flanks, from whence they were fir≈øt drawn forth; then let them face all to their Leader.

The tenth firing. Let the Muskettiers in Front and Reer face outward, and march cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let them face to Front and Reer, and give fire,
and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let the Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers face to the Front, and the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Front, face to the Reer; then let the outmo≈øt divi≈øions move, and clo≈øe ranks forward to Order; and let the Pikes charge on, and being retreated back again into their places, face all to the Front, and proceed to Figures of Battail according to the next direction.

Command. Half-files of Pikes, face about; Half-files of the four outmo≈øt Files of Muskettiers, face to the Reer; the four outmo≈øt Files, and the body of Pikes, move forward cleer of the ≈øtanding part; to your Leader: then let them face outward, and move two paces; then face to Front and Reer, and move the like; face all to your Leader, and clo≈øe Ranks forward, and Files inward in each divi≈øion; they will ≈øtand as followeth.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Reer-divi≈øions face about; then let the fir≈øt divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right and left, and fall in the room or place of the next divi≈øions, and they at the ≈øame time are to move up into their ground, giving fire, and falling off in like manner.
The ≈øecond firing. Let them give fire on the ground they ≈øtand in each divi≈øion, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let the Pikes charge on, whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again.

The third firing. Let the Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers move up, and range even abre≈øt with the fir≈øt divi≈øion; then let them fire altogether, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let tho≈øe that formerly moved up, face about, and march down again into their places; then let the Pikes charge on again as before, and being retreated, let them face all to both Flanks, and give fire in form and manner as they did to Front and Reer.

The fourth firing. Let the middle-divi≈øions of Muskettiers advance forward until they be cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let them all fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, and the middle-divi≈øions to move back again into their places; then face to their Leader, and move the inmo≈øt divi≈øion of Muskettiers upon the right in the Reer, to the left three paces, then proceed.

Command. Inmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Reer, double to the right filewi≈øe, and after that divi≈øion that doubled to face about, and pa≈øs through the intervals of Pikes, and place them≈øelves three foot behind the Reer; and the other divi≈øion that was doubled to advance forward through the interval of Pikes, and place them≈øelves three foot before the Front; then face to their Leader. Let the ≈øecond divi≈øion of Muskettiers from the Front ≈øtand, and all the re≈øt move forward three paces; then move the ≈øecond divi≈øions of Muskettiers to the right and left inward, until they ≈øtand ≈øtreight between the Front and Reer-divi≈øions of
Pikes; Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers, face about, and let them and the Reer-divi≈øion move forward and inward three paces; and after face to their Leader.

The fir≈øt firing. Let the Front-divi≈øion of Muskettiers fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves, then wheel off to the right by the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, and come down into the place or room of them in the Reer; and they at the ≈øame time are to move ≈øtreight forward up into the Front, and to give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then to wheel off to the right, as the Front-divi≈øions did, until they come into their places again. Then let the fir≈øt outmo≈øt divi≈øions give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and after wheel off to the right and left into the ground of the Reer-divi≈øions, who at the ≈øame time are to move forward into their places, and give fire, and fall off as the former did. The ≈øame firings may be perform'd to the Reer, they being thither faced.

The ≈øecond firing. Let them face to both Flanks, and give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves in each divi≈øion; then let the Pikes charge on to both Flanks, and being retreated back again into their places, let the Reer-divi≈øions of Muskettiers move forth cleer of the ≈øtanding part; then let them double Ranks to the right in each divi≈øion, and give fire altogether; after let them double Files to the left, and fire again four Ranks together, two kneel down, and two ≈øtand upright; then let the Pikes charge on, and being retreated, you may farther proceed.

Command. Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about, and march into your fir≈øt places; face all to your Leader: middle-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face outward, and move cleer of the ≈øtanding part; Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face about; Front-divi≈øion, and Reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers, move forward until you be cleer of the next divi≈øions of Pikes that ≈øtand before you; face all to your Leader, and they will ≈øtand as followeth.

The fir≈øt firing. Let them face all to the right Flank, and let the Front-divi≈øion give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let them wheel down into the Reer, they at the ≈øame time moving up into their ground, firing, and falling off, and moving down accordingly into their fir≈øt places; then let the other ≈øix divi≈øions fire after this manner: Fir≈øt the Front-divi≈øions, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel off to the right and left into the Reer of their own range, and the next divi≈øion may move forwards into their ground, give fire, and fall off in like manner: and ≈øo ≈øucce≈ø≈øively let every divi≈øion move up into their fir≈øt ground, relieving each other, until they have fired two or three times over in this manner.

The ≈øecond firing. Let them face to both Flanks, and let the inmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers move forth to the right and left, until they be cleer of the Pikes, who are to port; then the Muskettiers in each divi≈øion may give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then the Pikes may charge on, whil≈øt the Muskettiers make ready again; and being retreated into their places again, you may proceed to another Firing.

The third firing. Let the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers face to the Front and Reer, and the Pikes to the four Angles; then let them give fire to Front, Reer, and both Flanks on the ground they ≈øtand, in each divi≈øion, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then let the Pikes charge on to the four Angles, and being retreated into their places, move in the outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers into their places again; and then face all to their Leader.
Command. Outmo≈øt divi≈øions of Muskettiers, face to the right and left inward, and march until you range in the mid≈øt of Front and Reer-divi≈øions of Pikes; to your Leader.

Upon the former Figure, let the Front-divi≈øions of Muskettiers upon the Flanks move even with the Front of Pikes; then let them fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; then wheel about to the right and left into the place of the Reer-divi≈øions, who are to move forward into their ground, and to fire and fall off accordingly. Then let the middle-divi≈øions of Muskettiers in the Front move forward likewi≈øe, until they range even abre≈øt with the Front; give fire, and fall in the Reer of them≈øelves; and then move cleer forth, and wheel off to the right about into the ground of the reer-divi≈øion of Muskettiers ≈øtanding behind them; & they at the ≈øame time to move up into the Front, and to give fire in like manner, and to fall off accordingly, until they have attained their fir≈øt places.
